UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

positionName: Analyst, Analytics and Information, San Mateo
description:
Xelay Acumen Group, Inc.

Business Analyst, Analytics and Information


Company Description


Xelay Acumen Group, Inc is a strategy and management consulting firm serving

biotechnology, pharmaceutical, and health care provider clients. Our

engagements focus exclusively on high value-add for our clients’ most critically

important issues and challenges. Xelay Acumen strives to be the leading

healthcare strategy and management consulting firm focused on enabling

distinctive success for innovative products that matter. We deliver extraordinary

results for our healthcare clients by attracting and developing talented high

potential team members.


At Xelay Acumen Group, Inc., our people are excited to help clients address their

most pressing issues and challenges. We leverage the flexibility and expertise of

our virtual network and organization and bring to bear an unparalleled

combination of skill sets: strategic problem solving, rigorous analyses and

methodologies, and clear and concise communications to bring about uniquely

extraordinary results.


Job Description


Xelay Acumen Analysts are a diverse group of highly qualified people with a wide

range of backgrounds, from hard science to business. Offering challenging

responsibilities, broad business exposure and unrivaled career prospects, Xelay

Acumen’s Analyst are provided an unparalleled opportunity to apply knowledge,

business intuition, and analytical rigor to real-world challenges, building

invaluable skills and experience along the way. It's a great way to set yourself up

for future success—at Xelay Acumen and beyond. Candidates with all

experience levels are encouraged to apply.


The Business Analyst role is a full-time position to support strategic analyses of

clinical, medical, and market data within the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, and

health care provider industry, and collaborate with client and Xelay team

members to accomplish project engagement goals and objectives.


Analysts at Xelay Acumen tackle the most advanced and difficult problems our

clients face that drive the bottom-line financial returns and create tremendous

value, including

Conducting clinical trial data analytics and design
Supporting medical publications with novel analyses
Understanding and shaping new markets
Helping frame new business and medical treatment models
Assessing specific competitors' performance
Performing due diligence
1

Analysts are our frontline in developing powerful insights and driving results for

our clients. We invest heavily in our Analysts, and believe in the apprenticeship

model of management consulting. At Xelay Acumen, you will quickly acquire the

core capabilities of a successful, trustworthy analyst through the following

If you're ready to be part of our legacy of hope and innovation, we encourage you to take the first step and explore our current job openings. Your best is waiting to be discovered.
This is a Stanford Health Care job.

A Brief Overview
The LEAD BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST is responsible for first tier of support for user requests for user administration, enhancement requests, production incidents or outages related to Business Intelligence solutions owned by the CBA organization. In addition, this role will be involved in operational improvement projects, infrastructure and vendor product deployment projects, and development of BI solutions.

Locations
Stanford Health Care

What you will do
Develops/Enhances BI and ETL processes that reflect best practices for error handling, operations logging and alerting, scheduling and job control, etc.
Prepares/Updates design specifications and operations documentation for BI solutions promoted to the production environment.
Monitors production solutions and, where necessary, performs required manual procedures.
Perform user and tool administration within BI tools as requested and approved
Troubleshoots incidents surrounding supported solutions
Coordination with Infrastructure team on maintenance of hardware, upgrades, database administration/tuning, etc. of the EDW/BI environment.
Install/Test software patches/upgrades and test operating system, hardware, and database patches/upgrades installed by system administrators
Manage work queue of incidents and user requests within Service Management application
Identifies improvements to operational processes and leads projects to implement such improvements, applying solid project management skills, team/user communications, etc.
Understands and applies HIPAA standards and regulations to all areas of work
Education Qualifications
BS/BA in information or business-related field from an accredited college or university
Experience Qualifications
Five (5) years of experience with design and development of BI solutions and/or administration of BI tools
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
For Lead Business Intelligence Analyst (In General):
Experience delivering high quality Reporting & Analytics solutions that meet user requirements with minimal on-going maintenance and a low volume of production incidents (production failures, help desk calls, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot, and perform root cause analysis of, production incidents and establish countermeasures to improve supported applications.
Four (4)+ years of experience with SQL in an Oracle and/or SQL Server (preferred) environment. Proficient with complex SQL (multi joins, subqueries, unions) and creation of database objects (tables, views, materialized views, etc.).
Ability to utilize performance tuning utilities (Explain Plans, etc.) to optimize queries to meet user needs and improve normal operations.
Experience and expertise with Data Warehousing and ETL concepts, including: source to target mapping, transformations, error handling, job control, logging, alerting, and scheduling.
Demonstrated proficiency in Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), and Extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) design and development using SQL Server tools (SQL Management Studio, T-SQL, SSIS, Team Foundation, etc.), Oracle tools, and/or Epic Clarity Compass.
Complex Report writing & some metadata (i.e., BusinessObjects universes, QlikView QVW) creation with SHC standard tools. Effectively implemented upgrades/patches of these tools, managed production scheduling, and administered user access.
History of testing, developing, and sharing innovative practices of BI/ETL tools and evaluating/implementing new products or upgrades of existing products.
Ability to work without direct supervision based on general direction provided by a superior, provide guidance to peers on complex issues, and make recommendations to supervisors on best path forward. Provides regular updates to supervisor on pending tasks, pain points, and potential roadblocks while managing user expectations accordingly.
History of partnering with up to Tier 4 management of the organization (Directors and VP’s).
Demonstrated ability to complete multiple complex projects.
Actively coaches and mentors team members and contributes to the success and development of teams through informal and formal means.
Contributes to realization of SHC's vision. Understands how their work supports the vision and proposes better ways to achieve the vision. Articulates these ideas in a manner that builds consensus and influences decision making at the Director level.
Demonstrates expertise in multiple functional and/or technical domains and develops some cross-functional knowledge and skill outside scope of area of responsibility.
Ability to anticipate functional, design, or technical problems with standard recurring work or projects and negotiates a viable alternative before the issues manifests itself in production operations or development. Considers the "big picture" and develops solutions that address multiple problems or needs.
Ability to independently partner with multidisciplinary teams.
Track record of producing excellent work with limited problems or defects.
Solutions are recognized in industry publications or events for their quality and innovation.
Competent utilizing Lean concepts including visibility walls, problem solving A3’s, and Gemba rounding principles. Utilizes active daily management techniques.
Makes reliable operational internal decision independently and reliable tactical external decisions with limited supervision.
Successfully presents moderately complex ideas and information to a variety of audiences, including senior managers and industry groups. Strong and polished verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
For SHC-facing employees only:
o Proficient with, and contributes to, best practices and common processes for developing solutions with, and/or administering, multiple standard SHC tools, including the below:
o SAP BusinessObjects: BusinessObjects Enterprise (BOE), WebIntelligence, Crystal Reports, Xcelcius, BusinessObjects Data Services, CMC, SDK
o QlikView
o Microsoft SQL Server: SQL Server, SSIS, Management Studio, Team Foundation Services (TFS)
o Epic: Clarity ETL Admin (Compass), Clarity Data Model
o Oracle: Oracle RDMS10/11, Oracle Client
o Remedy/ITSM Service Management (Help Desk/Support) application
o Demonstrated experience with Windows Server management or coordination with Windows administrators to investigate/resolve Incidents, implement Windows patches, monitor hardware utilization, and perform hardware migrations/upgrades (of both virtual and non-virtual servers) as needed.

o Demonstrated experience with Windows Server management or coordination with Windows administrators to investigate/resolve Incidents, implement Windows patches, monitor hardware utilization, and perform hardware migrations/upgrades (of both virtual and non-virtual servers) as needed.

SHC Commitment to Providing an Exceptional Patient & Family Experience

Stanford Health Care sets a high standard for delivering value and an exceptional experience for our patients and families. location: 415 Mission Street, 3rd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
The Senior Sales Operations Reporting Analyst is responsible for building and standardizing a suite of reporting and data tools to maximize efficiency at all levels across the sales organization. This person will be a data expert and will play a critical role in developing a framework for scalable reporting, strategic planning, and supporting senior sales and sales operations leadership.
Projects may include defining and analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs), developing standard data sources for analytics and sales partners, deploying and refining industry best practice forecasting processes, in-depth ad hoc sales performance analysis, working cross functionally to support a scalable reporting infrastructure, and the packaging of findings/recommendations into presentation-ready content for senior leadership.
Some of the things you'll be doing will include...
Build repeatable processes and reporting packages to empower both sales leaders and reps with critical operational data related to sales strategy and execution.
Develop and maintain standardized operational reports, and dashboards, and data sources to monitor overall territory health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators
Monitor and share fluctuations in business critical KPIs with executive leadership
Support ongoing analysis of business performance. Inform executive decisions
Collect, analyze, evaluate, and report data to track sales performance and metrics
Support day-to-day inquiries from the sales team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational procedures and policies to manage volume.
Collaborate cross-functionally within the Sales Operations organization to ensure consistent reporting standards and processes
Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Finance teams on development of critical metrics
Who you are
Experienced. 8+ years of experience as a data analyst in consulting, finance, sales/marketing/operations, or product management. Experience at a top-tier management consultancy or investment bank, in a product management, sales operations, or in a similar business operations capacity at a technology firm. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related experience. Advanced degree is a plus.
Technically Savvy. Prior experience with Tableau Software strongly preferred. SQL experience is a plus. Technically savvy with a sense of urgency and accountability. Strong knowledge of relational database technologies such as Microsoft Excel, Salesforce, and Tableau’s full product suite.
Passionate. Passion for creating scalable reporting products that are intuitive to use and enable others to interpret data.
Exceptional Communicator. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts and information to a broad audience, including working with executive level leaders.
Urgency. Ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic work environment and can multi-task and keep on top of priorities while accomplishing the details of the task at hand.
Analytical. Ability to perform complex analysis including regression, forecasting, and probability modeling.
Team-Player . A natural leader with an ability to build things from scratch. A knack for creating structure wherever needed. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional roles where you network, build relationships and influence others.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders, and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world.
#LI-BC1

description:
REDWOOD CITY, CA // PWE - PLATFORM // FULL TIME
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE (BI) ANALYST
DESCRIPTION
Job Summary
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will use data analytics practices to address business challenges, provide recommendations and high-quality reporting solutions (reports, dashboards, visualizations, etc.). In addition, the BI Analyst will be a strong communicator, have a talent for simplifying analytic outputs, and demonstrate sound business judgment.

Responsibilities & Job Duties
Developing, maintaining, and managing advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards and other BI solutions
Performing and documenting data analysis, data validation, and data mapping/design/monitoring
Reviewing and improving existing BI solutions and collaborating with teams to integrate new BI solutions
Hands-on experience with Tableau Desktop (dashboard creation, report authoring and troubleshooting, data source management)
Build and publish interactive dashboards on Tableau Server
Collaborate with internal teams, clean and standardized data to meet the business requirements
Handling Ad-hoc requests from the stakeholders

Required Qualifications
3+ years of relevant experience in one of the following areas: Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, or Data engineering
1+ years of project delivery for BI oriented projects working within a large-scale data warehousing environment
Strong experience with SQL and Statistics
Strong experience with developing dashboards using Tableau
Working experience with at least one programming language like Python
Problem-solving, detail-oriented, strong communication skills, ability to convey complex results in a clear manner
Preferred Qualification
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (e.g., Statistics) or technical field (e.g., Computer Science)
Experience with Google BigQuery
Understanding of gaming industry, passion for video games

Every day, tens of millions of people from around the world come to Roblox to play, learn, work, and socialize in immersive digital experiences created by the community.

Our vision is to build a platform that enables shared experiences among billions of users. This is what's known as the metaverse: a persistent space where anyone can do just about anything they can imagine, from anywhere in the world and on any device. The breadth of opportunities, and the evolving demands of this first-of-its-kind platform, ensure that your avenues for growth are always expanding and flexible.

Join us and you'll usher in a new category of human interaction while solving exceptional challenges that you won't find anywhere else.
Role Overview

As an FP&A Analyst on the Finance team, you will contribute to our financial planning operations. We are looking for someone who has an eye for data and a passion for optimization. You are curious about every aspect of the business and provide insights on observed trends.

You will:

Provide accurate financial reporting with meaningful insight into trends and operating metrics.
Support Accounting's close processes on a monthly and quarterly basis on full P&L (revenue and expense).
Manage full-cycle budget reporting with functional group leaders. Our business model is maintained in Anaplan, builder experience with the tool is a plus.
Develop and participate in the company's annual strategic and operating plan, including budgeting, forecasting, and long-range planning support in departments.
Build in Anaplan dashboards for improved visibility and usability across the organization to allow thoughtful analyses and communication to functional leaders.
Help with finance integration activities, which may include software solutions and processes.
Provide thoughtful analyses to help guide strategic decisions throughout the company.
Report to Director, FP&A

You are:

Analytical and investigative skills
Bachelor's degree
2+ years of experience in finance-related field
Advanced skills for using Excel to analyze data and create financial and operational models plus PowerPoint to communicate analysis effectively
Experience with SQL, Netsuite, Anaplan, Tableau and other BI tools a plus

You'll Love:

Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
A rewarding 401k program
Flexible vacation policy
Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks
Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit
Annual CalTrain Go Pass
A Roblox Admin badge for your avatar

Description
At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.


Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day
In Relationship Management Team Support, we document, process and underwrite both residential and commercial loans. We provide exceptional client service to internal and external partners. We support our Relationship Managers in all aspects of the loan process to ensure that we are delivering a seamless lending experience to our clients.

Responsibilities
See service from a higher perspective.

As a Senior Loan Analyst, you will have the opportunity to process and underwrite single-family residential mortgageloans while providing an exceptional client experience. You will analyze complex tax returns and financial statements and assist in completing the loan process from start to finish. After you've developed a strong comfort level with the residential loan process, you'll have the opportunity to learn apartment and commercial property loan analysis and processing.

What you'll do as a Senior Loan Analyst:
Communicate with clients, providing excellent customer service and ensuring that the client relationship is maintained at the highest possible level.Analyze and process each loan file, ensuring that the Loan Approval Worksheet, loan narrative (if applicable), appraisal, application, preliminary title report and verifications meet secondary market and First Republic loan program criteria and are accurately documented and complete.Underwrite the income sources, collateral and credit quality ofresidential loan applications.This includes analysis of personal and business income tax returns, tax schedules and financial statements.Prepare loan files for funding by reviewing the analysis for accuracy.Complete the Request for Documents form to ensure that all regulatory information and loan terms are accurately entered into the computer system to meet compliance requirements.Complete Know Your Client regulatory data for all loan types.Follow the lending guidelines from the Federal National Mortgage Association and nonconforming secondary market investors, along with other industry regulations.Prepare prequalification and/or commitment letters for loan officer review.Learn the Bank's loan pricing matrix and become comfortable engaging with clients to confirm and discuss our loan programs.
Qualifications
You could be a great fit if you have:
Five years ofwork experience in residential loan processing and underwriting with commercial and/or construction loan processing and underwriting experience preferredAdditional work experience with an emphasis on customer service preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAdvanced computer skills
An orientation toward being a team player and providing extraordinary service while furthering the First Republic Bank culture and values
Job Demands:
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.

Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship.

First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

Leads, makes significant contributions, &/or provides technical leadership to high visibility projects to identify & resolve issues of strategic importance to the organization.Interfaces regularly w/ Sr Mgmt to produce timely & valuable results.Directs the development of outcomes & process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, & evaluation.Builds & maintains complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, & software written by self & others.Tests & maintains data integrity across multiple databases (internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL).Builds sophisticated statistical models & forecasting tools using these databases.Designs & enhances databases.Designs menu systems that are effective & user-friendly.Develops reports w/ accurate, easy to read, useful information that satisfies the client's needs.Designs & generates tracking & monitoring tools.Designs research plans for data gathering & analysis; participates significantly in interpreting analyses & developing action plans accordingly.

We're transforming the grocery industry

Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we've been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.

Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it's more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.
OVERVIEW

We are seeking an organized, analytical, and highly motivated individual to join Instacart's Trust & Safety organization, focusing on analytics in Compliance and Safety & Claims. The ideal candidate can leverage a combination of deep analytics skills and business acumen to identify, extract, and visualize opportunities across all areas of Trust & Safety, which can then be used to drive meaningful improvements across various segments of the company. Additionally, the ideal candidate possesses excellent time-management skills, the ability to communicate & present information effectively to business partners at all levels, and a deep-seated passion for continuous improvement, data integrity, and scalable solutions.

ABOUT THE JOB

Own data analysis and visualization as it relates to all areas of Trust & Safety; critical response, claims & settlements, shopper and customer misconduct, background checks, food safety, alcohol delivery, and other policies and compliance initiatives, etc,.. Regularly communicate associated outcomes and insights to various stakeholders at all levels, including senior management to help guide strategic decisions for improvement
Develop dashboards, analytical frameworks, and detailed reporting models that provide reliable, easily-digestible insights to key stakeholders to help guide decisions around process, policy, systems, and service models
Develop a deep understanding of how each area of the business impacts the other and the underlying correlations relating to key company metrics, as well as the identification of potential root causes contributing to potential change(s) in metrics
Directly manage small team of data analysts (1 data analyst) by providing key technical, analytical, tactical, strategic, and career guidance
Create automated reporting to ensure operations leaders are informed of variations and opportunities across geographies and teams
Analyze unstructured behavioral data to discover operational events and activities impacting Trust & Safety and customer, shopper, and retailer experience
Fundamentally change the way our teams across North America think about exceptional performance and customer experiences through innovative, value-added data approaches and insights
Regularly collaborate with other analysts, subject matter experts, and decision-makers to develop data-driven policies and models to improve overall Trust & Safety products, policies, procedures, and processes.
Retrieve and aggregate data from multiple sources and compile it into a digestible and actionable format
Self motivated to Identifying opportunity to automate and scale reports
Work independently as the key resource for day-to-day analytic needs
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Build strong partnerships and relationships with partners in Central Operations, Product, Engineering, and Data Science.

ABOUT YOU

Minimum 5-8 years in analytics, business intelligence/operations, investment banking, or related environment
2-3 years people management experience
Ability to write complex and performant queries in your dialect of SQL to extract data from our data warehouse (Hive or Presto experience a plus)
Experience with R, Python, and/or Julia (fluency in at least one language preferred)
Experience with analytical visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Periscope or similar tools
Extremely strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to synthesize complex topics and create compelling narratives for various audiences
Excellent teamwork skills and desire to help others learn
High level of accountability and ownership – driven and focused self-starter
Strategic mindset – the ability to think ahead of where the company is at now
Understanding of statistical inference and other forms of statistical analysis using statistical packages similar to R, SAS, or Pandas

Bonus points:

Experience in Trust & Safety, compliance, safety, fraud, or identity field
Experience in advanced reporting tools such as R Shiny, Dash, or Bokeh
Advanced degree in statistics or other quantitative fields
Data modeling, ETL and data pipeline development experience

Company Description


Xelay Acumen Group, Inc is a strategy and management consulting firm serving

biotechnology, pharmaceutical, and health care provider clients. Our engagements focus

exclusively on high value-add for our clients’ most critically important issues and challenges.

Xelay Acumen strives to be the leading healthcare strategy and management consulting firm

focused on enabling distinctive success for innovative products that matter. We deliver

extraordinary results for our healthcare clients by attracting and developing talented high

potential team members.


At Xelay Acumen Group, Inc., our people are excited to help clients address their most

pressing issues and challenges. We leverage the flexibility and expertise of our diverse

network and organization and bring to bear an unparalleled combination of skill sets: strategic

problem solving, rigorous analyses and methodologies, and clear and concise communications

to bring about uniquely extraordinary results.


Job Description


Xelay Acumen Business Analysts are a diverse group of highly qualified people with a wide

range of backgrounds, from hard science to literature. Offering challenging responsibilities,

broad business exposure and unrivaled career prospects, Xelay Acumen’s Analyst role

provides an unparalleled opportunity to apply knowledge, business intuition, and analytical

rigor to real-world challenges, building invaluable skills and experience along the way.

Generally, Analysts join directly out of college or university, from a Master's program, or after

less than three years of work experience. It's a great way to set yourself up for future

success—at Xelay Acumen and beyond. Analysts are the heart and soul of our organization.

They are our frontline in developing powerful insights and driving results for our clients. We

invest heavily in our Analysts, and believe in the apprenticeship model of management

and medical treatment models, assessing specific competitors' performance, performing due

objectives. Responsibilities include:

ABOUT USAt Vida, we empower individuals to overcome chronic mental and physical health conditions, once and for all. The impact of chronic conditions on healthcare is immense: in the US alone, chronic diseases like diabetes and heart disease drive 80% of the $3 trillion healthcare spending, which is at 18% of GDP. One in 3 individuals has a chronic health condition, and 1 in 4 struggles with mental health.Vida provides expert, personalized, on-demand health coaching and programs from a network of experienced health care providers and leading medical institutions. Vida is a next generation continuous care platform for both consumers and businesses, combining a consumer mobile app, an enterprise care platform offering on demand 24/7 solutions for chronic conditions. Vida platform runs in the cloud, captures real-time data from 100+ devices and apps, and integrates back to the employer, payer, and provider. We are trusted by Fortune 1000 companies, major national payers and large providers to enable their employees live their healthiest lives.*_**Vida is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Vida is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Please speak with your recruiter to learn more about where Vida is registered._*About the Job:Our Medical Team is the vanguard of Vida’s mission. Our task is to scale our services into the millions of patients without sacrificing any of the transformational outcomes or human touches that make them special. Doing so requires a crack team with the most diverse skills in the company spanning computer science, data engineering, clinical operations and medicine.We are looking for a senior healthcare data analyst - someone with the database skills to assemble complex data from our ecosystem and the analytical skills to interpret them in a clinically rigorous way. Experience working with healthcare claims is a must.Because Vida is a startup, you’ll have the opportunity to work on a diverse set of projects and to build the foundations of our healthcare analytics. If you have organizational skills and a knack for leadership, you’ll find broad freedom to build our systems and direct our strategy.Our team shares a passion for learning and innovation, and so we take supporting career growth and skill development very seriously. Our team motto: 1.01**365 = 37.8 Learning compounds!Specific Duties and Responsibilities: Design, plan and develop clinical quality reports, for both internal and external audiences, primarily using SQLManage medical claims and biometrics data acquisitionDerive key insights for both internal clinical guidance and external reporting from medical administrative claims. These may range from identifying eligible patients with relevant medical conditions (e.g. diabetes on certain medication classes) through to case-control difference-in-difference total cost of care analysesExplore clinical operations and find creative tech-enabled solutions to improve and scale themShare your skills and your findings with our teamDevelop tools and best practices to apply data insights towards clinical quality questionsDesign and analyze experiments, communicate results, and drive decisionsMinimum education and experience: Bachelor’s degreeMust be skilled with complex SQL queriesFluency with a scripting language, preferably PythonAdditional qualifications: Experience in the healthcare industry particularly with operations, either directly working in operations or as an operations analystStrong experience with end to end data processing pipelines, from data ingestion to advanced analyticsExperience working with JiraStrong experience with end to end data processing pipelines, from data ingestion to advanced analytics particularly with Google Cloud PlatformAbility to work in a in fast-paced, high-growth environment of competing and alternating priorities with constant focus on deliveryExperience collaborating with multidisciplinary teamsAbility to communicate technical insights to non-technical audiencesOurs is a distributed team by design, and so we are largely flexible on location.#LI-AE1_Vida is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.__Diversity is more than a commitment at Vida—it is the foundation of what we do. Requisition ID # 118680

Job Category : Business Operations / Strategy
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Information Technology

Team Overview
PG&E’s Information Technology (IT) organization is comprised of various unified departments which collaborate effectively in order to deliver high quality technology solutions.
The Data, Analytics, & Insights organization is an enterprise team that is responsible for working collaboratively across various lines of business (e.g. Gas Operations, Electric Operations, Safety, Energy Procurement, etc.) and is focused on unlocking the value of PG&E’s data to support the company’s Wildfire Safety Program. As part of that focus, we focus on delivering data and AI/ML centric products to support these initiatives. Some of the products that are being delivered include Remote Inspections, AI Enabled Inspections, Vegetation Management through LiDAR capabilities, Transmission Line Asset Master, Electric Distribution Asset Master, Asset Risk Modeling, and a Cloud Native Foundational Platform.
A critical part of how we operate is to apply design thinking, work and observe the Agile development methodology, and co-location. Through these principles, we work as product teams to help deliver a valuable product to our business.

Position Summary:
We are seeking a Business Analyst on the Data, Analytics, & Insight Team. The role will be on the Analytic Product Strategy Team, following the Agile methodology and DevOps practices to help the team deliver impactful data products for internal PG&E partners. You will lead new product and feature use case intake as well as facilitate portfolio prioritization efforts to effectively deliver our products and services. You will actively participate in an open, highly collaborative Agile environment. A successful candidate will have a strong understanding of one or more lines-of-business, and will be able to identify and guide the team to areas of highest enterprise value. Additionally, they will be responsible for developing an environment where teams can be successful by removing roadblocks, fostering a culture of agility, and providing leadership & guidance. Further, they should be able to translate business needs into functional requirements, and technical concepts into business value.

Position Responsibilities:
Works with multiple Line-of Business stakeholders to intake new products and features and prioritize technical development
Dives deep into business problems to understand where process changes will be needed to leverage technical capabilities, and champions process change where needed
Represents the interests of the business to the team; represents the product and the team to the business
Anticipates client concerns and questions, and provides proactive, timely and professional client-focused communications.
Have a passion for using data & analytics to create novel ways to solve business problems
Communicates with stakeholders regularly
Understands the business value of each user story
Works collaboratively with team of developers, e.g. data engineers, data scientists, UI/front end developers and designers, along with stakeholders, and supporting teams to deliver needed capabilities
Balances team workload with business user and leadership expectations
Excellent written and oral communication skills across all levels
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Self-motivated, able to manage schedule, priorities and deadlines and to deliver quality work product
Cross-domain and cross-functional knowledge that will enable design of the best possible technology capabilities
Provides mentorship and guidance to less experienced employees

Qualifications

Minimum Education/Skills:
BA/BS in Information Systems, Business, Engineering, etc. or equivalent work experience Minimum of 6 or more years of experience in business analysis, project management, business architecture and/or other related area

Desired Education / Skills: Relevant advanced degree Excellent analytical and technical skills Excellent written and oral communication skills, capable of using common office productivity software Demonstrated ability to develop and manage to budgets
Demonstrated ability to effectively navigate complex organizational, process, technical and political challenges
Strong leadership skills in the technology domain and a high level of drive, initiative and assertiveness
Deep knowledge and understanding of one or more PG&E lines-of-business
Experience identifying benefits and developing business plans Knowledge of data management principles, data acquisition and modeling, data warehousing, business intelligence, metadata management, data security Knowledge of data governance principles
Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, GitHub, Slack, Tableau
Experience with software development methodologies and software engineering principles, with an emphasis on data related development techniques
Knowledge of program management theories, concepts, methods, best practices, and techniques as needed to perform at the job level
Competency in developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Good understanding of the Agile methodology and DevOps practices
Experience working with scrum teams
Experience with design thinking
Utility industry experience preferred

What you will get The opportunity to work on some of the most interesting, complex, real world data problems that will make a difference for PG&E, PG&E’s customers, and the Utility industry as a whole The opportunity to contribute to a best in class organization that ships real products to real users Extreme management support for your development and your day to day success Autonomy to make decisions in a rapidly growing team Best in class perks and benefits

Position Summary

The Business Analyst will provide functional support for the PeopleSoft student administrative system (Campus Solutions) and Salesforce CRM for the College of Extended Learning and will receive work assignments from their lead, the Director of Enrollment. Provides the interface between technical resources and stakeholders to define, discuss, and document requirements and solutions, analyze and propose changes to those requirements, where appropriate, for a best fit within the overall PeopleSoft structure and the functional organization operational choices; in similar fashion, help design/specify work with technical staff and business side customers when enhancing/customizing applications in the Campus Solutions environment. The Business Analyst coordinates testing of new applications, maintenance packs, upgrades to existing applications to ensure integrity and quality of data while providing user training. Defines and develop test scenarios required for acceptance and system testing. Maintains help desk documentation for SME and any recommendations for process/procedure improvements. Establishes and manages liaison relationship with department operational users to provide technical solutions. Manages functional user security and coordinates the operational support for the PeopleSoft Campus Solutions system and Salesforce CRM for the College of Extended Learning.

This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, educational technology, communications, or related fields, or similar certified coursework in applicable fields of study. Foundation knowledge and skills for the Information Technology Consultant, depending on the nature of the position assignment, may include working knowledge of common software application packages, equipment platforms, reference database systems and sources, and training methods and a basic understanding of networks, data communication, and multimedia systems.
Typically, incumbents have acquired the requisite skills and knowledge through a combination of education, training, and progressive work experience to be able to demonstrate competence in independently applying technical judgment to standard and nonstandard applications and systems, solving a wide range of problems and developing practicable and thorough solutions, and using effective communication and listening skills. Incumbents at this level work relatively independently and possess the experience to be fully proficient in performing most or all of the work assignments defined for their position.
A background check (which may include: checks of employment records, education records, criminal records, civil records, motor vehicle records, professional licenses, and sex offender registries, as position requires). Strong statistical and analytical skill set.

Ability to assimilate, retain, and utilize technical and application-oriented information.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Information Systems.

Familiarity with Big Data Analytics

Overview of eero:
Wifi is the foundation of the modern home. Without it, nothing works. eero, an Amazon company, is the first company to deliver a whole home WiFi experience using mesh technology, ensuring there isn’t a home layout or connected device we can’t handle. Fixing connectivity is, however, just the start. We’re working on the building blocks of the smart home by designing our own hardware, enabling it with powerful software, and tying it all together to the cloud. A home that anticipates our needs, takes care of us and our families, keeps us safe and healthy, and saves money and energy.

Overview of the Business Intelligence Analyst role:
At eero, all business decisions are data driven. The Business Intelligence team provides strategic and tactical support for key decision makers in Accounting, Finance, Manufacturing Operations, and Marketing. We build robust tools that provide valuable insights, enabling the company to best navigate the competitive landscape of wifi consumer electronics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for building and maintaining automated reporting and self-service solutions that will scale as eero continues to grow. You will be the expert who can provide ad-hoc support and help educate stakeholders on data best practices.

What you’ll do:

Architect scalable, best-in-class business intelligence solutions and processes.
Automate manual data collection and manipulation traditionally done in Excel, enabling partners to focus on problems that actually require their expertise.
Create robust data marts where stakeholders can easily generate insights
Own and maintain business data models in Looker:
Become the go-to person if our partners have any questions or issues with data or dashboards
Diagnose issues on the fly and provide guidance with metrics and visualizations
Provide cross-functional strategic and tactical support.
Run ad-hoc analyses to help drive projects and key business initiatives forward
Maintain documentation and provide cross-functional training.
Document data definitions, key metrics and sample reports, ensuring alignment and consistency in reporting across the company
Experience working with an analytics platform (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Knowledge of/willingness to learn Python
Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence or comparable project management/collaboration tools
Understanding of agile product development framework

BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER.
When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference.
Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work.
They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business.
Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply.
Job Description
The Analytics & Sales Operations team ensures SVB’s complex and ever-evolving business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major bank business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.
In this role, you will partner closely with the Business Development team and specifically to work on a collaborative and cross-functional team and to empower SVB sales originators. You will shape the way we work, through operational cadence, go-to-market initiatives and reporting and enhance the success of every sales originator by empowering their decision making with data, analytics, and insights.
This position offers the opportunity to join a team of talented Sales Operations professionals, and to collaborate with sales, operations, product, marketing, legal and finance to translate go-to-market strategies into operations that sustain and accelerate growth.
Primary Responsibilities:
Managing the process of identifying and tiering the best prospects and aiding in lead generation
Supporting prospect calls and meetings by preparing sales originators with appropriate research on financials and market trends
Preparing regularly occurring reports on business and industry performance to track strategic objectives
Training sales originators on CRM and reporting tools to drive analysis of pipelines, sales and activities
Collaborating with Sales, Sales Technology, and Sales Enablement teams to document, communicate, and enforce policies and processes
Automating and improving scalable processes, tools, and dashboards to drive operational and business efficiency

description:
Offers functional expertise within portfolio and project teams to support portfolio and functional owners define and deploy solutions. Helps evaluate and define work effort and associated costs of new service requests and projects. Assists in requirements gathering and defining business needs. Includes analysis/evaluation of business and/or system process and functional requirements and development of business cases. Develops relationships with upstream and downstream business partners and customer groups. Identifies opportunities for business or process improvement and makes associated recommendations as appropriate.
Essential Responsibilities:
Supports and provides functional expertise on programs and projects as assigned. Broad application of principles, theories, and concepts in applicable discipline, plus working knowledge of other related fields. Uses professional concepts in accordance with company objectives to solve complex problems in creative and effective ways.
Develops consistent partnerships of shared ownership to resolve and identify impacts between teams. Demonstrates functional area business processes and thoroughly understands assigned cross functional areas.
Directs the analysis of enterprise-wide or very complex client needs in project areas such as new/existing business processes, innovative approaches to solutions support, market research of emerging or available product functionality and operational readiness assessment.
Focus on continued improvement and upgrades of current processes and technology. Sponsors opportunities for increasing business efficiency through improved manual and automated process systems.
Directs the development of comprehensive and strategic business cases with cost/benefit dimensions of proposed projects that are used at management and executive levels for funding and scope decisions.
Oversees the maintenance of domain and/or system knowledge including the development of comprehensive process and system documentation.
Accountable for tracking and/or monitor and report for senior management the results of actualization of benefits.
Directs/conducts the analysis of current business processes and functional requirements. Prepares appropriate documentation to communicate and validate the information. Identifies other initiatives that exist and ensures that efforts are not duplicated.
Consults on the integration of application systems into the work environment.
Identifies and coordinates with other project managers and implements schedule deadlines as appropriate. Manages common resource demands. Provides on-going project management and status reporting at all levels. Provides advice and input into the project plan. Develops techniques for compiling, preparing and presenting data.
Team Leadership: May provide coaching and training; may conduct performance reviews, participate in interviews and provides input to hiring team members. May assign and manage workflow of team members.

Experience
Minimum ten (10) years directly related experience, to include three (3) years in a consultative role required.
Education
Bachelor's degree in business adminstration, management science, industrial engineering-operations research, or related field, OR four (4) years experience in a directly related field required.
High school diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.
License, Certification, Registration
N/A

Ability to influence multiple cross-functional, and/or multiple cross divisional task forces to identify and document functional requirements, workflow, information sources and system/process specifications.
Ability to establish cross-functional task forces.
Thorough knowledge of platforms within the assigned areas and multiple cross functionality based on assignment.
Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Twelve (12) years directly related experience, to include five (5) years in a consultative role.
Five (5) years related experience in Healthcare environment.
Master's degree in business administration, management science, industrial engineering-operations research, or related field preferred.
Certification or advanced qualification by third party association that matches the function or field applicable to the business discipline (i.e., AHIP, HIAA, etc.).

Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win – shoppers, retailers, society and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people and reward them for doing the right thing. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.
Founded five years ago in Sydney, Australia, Afterpay has over 11 million active customers globally and more than 64,000 of the world’s best retailers around the world including Anthropologie, Revolve, DSW, GOAT, Finish Line, Levi’s, Mac Cosmetics, Ray-Ban and many others. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins. Afterpay is completely free for customers who pay on time – helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees or extended debt.

Afterpay empowers customers to access the things they want and need, while still allowing them to maintain financial wellness and control, by splitting payments in four, for both online and in-store purchases. Afterpay is deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers. We are focused on supporting our community of shoppers. We trust in the next generation and share a vision of a more accessible and sustainable world in which people are rewarded for doing the right thing.
The Opportunity
As a Lead Technical Analyst/Data Scientist in global marketing analytics team, you will work closely with our global growth partners to acquire, activate and retain customers, drive mobile app download through paid, organic and CRM channels. You will be working in wide range of marketing domains, using analytical and data science tools to tackle challenges Afterpay and the advertising industry are facing. As a lead individual contributor, you will own full cycle of analytics/data science projects from problem formulation to final implementation/recommendation. Most importantly, be a thought partner of global growth team to make impact and help deliver the team's topline OKRs.
We are much more than our job descriptions - we are our energy, our ideas, our everyday drive. Here’s where you will begin….
Work with advertising platforms (for example, Google, FB) to design, execute and analyze incrementality testCausal inference and modelingAnalyze and model user life cycle to activate, reactivate user as well as prevent user churnEstablish full funnel marketing analytics frameworkOptimize paid channel portfolio and financial forecastUnderstand marketing efficiency/ROI with different categoriesUser life time value analysis and modeling
Who are you? (Qualifications)
Like us, you’ll be deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers and passionate about shaping the future of Afterpay. You like to keep it real with your actions, be brave with your decisions, do the right thing for all our stakeholders and shape the future with excitement.
Quantitative background in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplinesProficient in SQL and PythonAbility to do statistical analyses with minimal guidance including descriptive and inferential techniquesBachelor’s degree with 8+ years of relevant working experience, or master degree from quantitative fields with 5+ year relevant experience, or Ph.D degree from quantitative fields with 3+ year experienceConfident with analytics techniques such as Predictive Modelling, Regression and classification analyses, A/B testing, etc.Work experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BIStrong organizational/time/project management skills and able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously and to tight deadlinesSolid management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to tight deadlinesStrong problem solving and analysis skills, combined with effective judgment and exceptional communication skillsPrior experience in causal modeling, paid marketing or CRM is a big plus
How we reward you. We have a pay for performance culture so you can expect to be rewarded for high performance. We pride ourselves on fairness and offer a competitive total reward package made up of salary, incentives and benefits including the opportunity to enroll in our share matching plan.
We have a strong focus on health and wellbeing at Afterpay as we aim to support you to succeed in both your career and personal lives, such as providing employees with a corporate membership to Headspace. We offer a wide range of insurance programs so you have the flexibility to choose what is best for you. Afterpay covers 100% of the employee cost and 75% of the cost of your dependents.
We value diversity and a collaborative and inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong is important to us.
How to Apply: We don’t know what the future holds. That’s the exciting part; we show up and make it happen. If you’re brave, if you’re committed to doing the right thing and excited by this opportunity, click apply now!

Company Description
Sense is a diverse, collaborative team tackling one of the most universal challenges in today’s workforce. With a mission to change the way companies engage with talent, we’re creating a better experience for employers, recruiters, and candidates. Your work at Sense will impact millions of people around the globe and will be instrumental in evolving an entire industry. Join us in shaping the workforce of the future!
Founded in 2015, Sense is a high-growth HR Tech SaaS startup with offices in the Bay Area and Bangalore. It has 150+ team members, serves 500+ customers, and has grown 100% year-over-year since launch. We have raised over $40M in funding, backed by GV (Google), Accel, and Avataar Ventures.
As a part of the Sense team, you’ll play an active role in shaping and developing our products and processes. Our founders are lifelong entrepreneurs with a history of building, scaling, and successfully exiting large companies. At Sense, your career goals will be supported through active mentorship and learning and development opportunities. We’re an experienced team and looking for great people to add to our team.

Job Description
BizOps at Sense is a cross-functional team that sits at the intersection of data, operations and strategy. As a centralized team we support all teams at Sense. Our partners and stakeholders rely on us for a data-driven perspective and a consultative partnership. As a Sr. Analyst and member of the team, you will deliver insights that drive decision-making, execution and investments for key initiatives. In this more operations-focused role, success requires analytical savvy, problem-solving sophistication and a dedication to making the highest impact.
This is a strategic role that has the following mandate:
Drive a smooth investment allocation planning process through a deeper understanding of our Go-to-Market team and portfolio and ensuring the right tools and data to create leverage for our PDE organization.
Partner with our marketing, sales, and customer success leaders to deeply understand the customer journey funnel and its respective dynamics, understand the impact of key initiatives, and forecast business outcomes.
Explore, evaluate and support new investment opportunities and strategic initiatives
Responsibilities:
Partner with team leaders on strategic headcount planning, which can include tracking and presenting team ratios, hiring velocity, internal transfers, and more
Build and update forecasting models, in coordination with Corporate Finance & Recruiting, around hiring and attrition.
Work with team leaders to maintain hiring priorities, approve internal headcount changes and manage the backfill approval process.
Build dashboards (including writing queries, if possible) to track and report on quarterly GTM key performance indicators (KPIs) & measures.
Identify net-new valuable work and spearhead initiatives to streamline processes and increase efficiency.
Communicate solutions confidently and effectively across Sense
Build a consultative relationship across the organization, and meet with strategic partners that align with our highest priorities.
We strive to build a culture that balances our values with high standards of execution. You are someone who can:
Effectively use Google Sheets for scenario modeling, sensitivity analysis, etc.
Remain meticulous and detail oriented while working on a variety of projects.
Understand how to tie workflows to data sets, complex problems and extract insights with frameworks and analyses.

Qualifications

2+ years of related work experience at a high-performing tech company (Saas experience preferred)
Advanced analytical skills (including data modeling) and business insight
Experience with financial systems (e.g., Recurly, Stripe, Anaplan)
Ability to build clear and concise models and presentations
Effective communicator with peers and senior leaders
Strong project management skills
Bonus Points:
Practical experience writing SQL queries and pulling data from relational databases
Additional Information
Perks & Benefits

401K program to help you invest in your future
Unlimited PTO to promote a healthy work-life harmony
Equity
Sense is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity, inclusion, and belonging is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

SUMMARY

Under the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Epidemiology and Laboratory Capacity (ELC) cooperative agreement, Heluna Health, and the Division of Communicable Disease Control (DCDC) of the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) are recruiting for an Data Analyst (informatics) at for the Epidemiology and Surveillance Team within the COVID-19 California Department of Public Health (CDPH) response.

This position will join the team leading the development of innovative solutions within the CDPH data environment to enhance interoperability of our data systems and integrate these solutions with local health jurisdictions (LHJs) and other relevant public health partners to improve surveillance of COVID-19 and achieve organizational goals.

The position responsibilities include the development and implementation of enhanced Covid-19 surveillance projects, facilitation of electronic collection and transfer of data related to testing, vaccination, or hospitalizations forCOVID-19, and synthesis and coordination of communicating these data to public health partners across multiple data environments. This position requires strong programming and/or informatics knowledge to support the development of these efforts.

If selected for an interview, candidates will be expected to share excerpts of code to demonstrate proficiency in R, python, SQL or other similar language. The position will interact and collaborate with several multidisciplinary CDPH teams as well as other internal and external partners as they contribute to the CDPH COVID-19 pandemic response.

Applicants must submit a cover letter and curriculum vitae to be considered. Please provide three professional references.

Must be able to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Design workflows and processes for automating data management and quality assurance across multiple data environments
Develop innovative solutions for the interoperability of data systems among federal, state and local health departments, commercial and governmental laboratories, hospitals and medical providers, academic partners, and other public health entities.
Collaborate with CDPH COVID19 response teams including surveillance/epidemiology, outbreak investigations, contact tracing, policy makers, information technology, and leadership to enhance and/or obtain systems for storing, analyzing, reporting, and sharing COVID19-related data.
Develop and implement procedures to ensure data integrity, security, and confidentiality of public health data. Understand industry best practices, stakeholder needs, and future directions to ensure CDPH remains in compliance.
Lead and manage the development of datasets, data visualizations, dashboard, data access, and reporting applications and written reports.
Conceptualize, coordinate, and produce internal reports and public-facing materials (e.g. tables and visualizations) that describe/interpret epidemiologic analysis that influence COVID-19 control and prevention policy.
Present at meetings and scientific conferences, if applicable.
Participate in conference calls with key stakeholders at CDPH, local health jurisdictions (LHJs), CDC, and academic partners.
Perform other duties as directed by CDPH Leadership.
Collaborate effectively with team members.

 NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Performs other duties as required or assigned

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Strong programming and informatics skills (R, SQL, python or similar programming language).
Experience in designing/engineering data workflows and processes for automating ETL, data cleaning, and data quality assessments from structured and unstructured data sources.
Experience with health information interoperability standards such as HL7 and FHIR.
Knowledge of fundamentals and principles of epidemiology, biostatistics, and public health.
High level analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with public health and healthcare professionals as well as internal partners.
Knowledge and application of security and confidentiality requirements for reportable disease/public health surveillance data and protection of public health information.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and work well independently and with a team.
Demonstrate reliability, integrity and attention to detail.
Fluency in spoken and written English is required.

Education/Experience
Master’s degree in public health, informatics, computer science or related field, required
Expertise in a programming language such as R, python, SQL, or similar language, required.
Two years of experience in a public health department and/or infectious disease surveillance, preferred.
Two years of experience in data management, informatics, data science, preferred.
Experience with health information interoperability standards such as HL7 and FHIR, preferred
Experience creating data visualization using R, python, D3, or Tableau, preferred.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience in coordinating complex projects.
