positionName: Cybersecurity GRC Senior Analyst (IS Business Analyst-Senior) - Department of Technology (1053)
company: City and County of San Francisco
location: 1 South Van Ness Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94103
description:
Company Description
Applicants are encouraged to apply immediately as this recruitment may close at any time but not earlier than October 25, 2021. The position is open until filled.
IMPORTANT: Your application MUST include responses to the supplemental questionnaire found HERE.
Applicants must complete the supplemental questionnaire prior to starting the online application process. Applicants will not be reviewed without completed supplemental questionnaire.
The Department of Technology is the centralized technology services provider within San Francisco City & County government, delivering technology infrastructure and services to approximately 33,000 employees and 800,000 residents. The department has an annual operating budget of over $130M and contains over 220 employees. Core service areas include: Infrastructure and Operations, Technology Security, Service Delivery & Management, Enterprise Applications, Project Management Office, Public Safety Systems & Wiring, Technology Administration, Policy & Governance and IT Public Communications.
Our award-winning cybersecurity team has been recognized for setting the standard for excellence among the City. We are a service-oriented and dynamic group, who are both responsible for their own success but are firmly committed to our mission.
In alignment with our vision of serving as a model for a secure government, ensuring data confidentiality and integrity, as well as service availability, we have embarked on a mission to further mature the City’s cybersecurity program. Through the governance, risk, and compliance pilar of cybersecurity, we will strengthen the cyber program by further developing administrative controls, enhancing our risk management program, evolving vendor assessments, meeting compliance through adherence to regulatory frameworks, and cross-functionally working with senior management to align business and security goals.

Job Description
The City and County of San Francisco (City) are hiring a Cybersecurity GRC Senior Analyst. The analyst will support a critical function of the City's Cybersecurity Division that will be directly responsible for reducing risks posed to the City. The analyst will be tasked with the important role of identifying, assessing, controlling, and monitoring risks through the Citywide enterprise. They will gain firsthand experience supporting and maturing a GRC program.
Essential Job Duties and Functions:
Perform cyber risk assessments against City cybersecurity requirements.
Conduct Vendor Risk Assessments to assess security posture of vendors.
Support the cyber awareness training and education program, including phishing simulations.
Track and monitor risk mitigation plans’ and develop reports in accordance with GRC metrics.
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor IT-related security risks/hazards
Perform review of policies and supporting procedures/processes.
Conduct technical research to aid in threat assessment and risk mitigation activities, as well as changes in the industry as it relates to security.
Help develop and monitor cybersecurity controls and support City departments in control maintenance

Qualifications
Education:
An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field].
Experience:
Three (3) years in the information systems field, including system analysis, business process design, development and implementation of business application solutions or IT project management.

Substitution:
Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field.
Desirable Qualifications:
3-5 years working in a cyber GRC type role.
Risk Analytics experience within IT
Familiar with cybersecurity frameworks (NIST CSF/RMF, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP, etc).
Familiar with security standards (i.e. HIPAA, PCI-DSS, etc).
Familiar with vendor risk management assessments (i.e. SOC2, CAIQ, etc).
Comfortable having a technical discussion.
Proficient in Excel or similar.
Ability to define and communicate risk in business-relevant language
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to communicate IT risk concepts to non-technical people
Comfortable with quantitative risk management, Factor Analysis of Information Risk (FAIR).
Familiar with Auditing cybersecurity and technical policies and controls
Familiar with GRC platforms (i.e. SNOW, LogicGate, OneTrust, etc)
Preferred a security certification (i.e. Security+, CISA, CISM, CRISC, etc)
Preferred skills in SharePoint and reporting services
Familiar with Privacy concepts.
Note:
1. Medical Testing: Prior to appointment, eligible candidates must successfully pass the TB testing process.
2. Security Clearances & Background Investigations: Positions in this classification may require that successful candidates who become eligible for appointment may be required to go through a background investigation to determine the candidate’s suitability for employment in this classification. Factors considered in the investigation may include employment history, use of illegal/controlled substances. Reasons for rejection based on this investigation may include, but not limited to: applicable convictions, repeated or serious violations of the law, inability to accept supervision, inability to follow rules and regulations, falsification of application materials and/or other relevant factors. Failure to obtain and maintain security clearance may be basis for termination.

Additional Information
Benefits: https://sfdhr.org/benefits-overview
Salary Range: Rates Effective: Jul 01, 2021 - Jan 07, 2022, $53.4500 - $67.2500 (hourly)
 Rates Effective: Jan 08, 2022 - Jun 30, 2022, $53.7125 - $67.5875 (hourly)
Contact Information: Carol Wong, Human Resources – Client Services, by telephone at 652-628-5045, or by email at carol.x.wong@sfgov.org
Right to Work:
All persons entering the City and County of San Francisco workforce are required to provide verification of authorization to work in the United States. Please be informed that the Department of Technology will not sponsor visa applications/transfer.
This positions is NOT supporting 100% remote work and employee for this position will need to live in the Bay Area.
CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT: All City and County of San Francisco employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. For details on how it is applicable to your employment, please click here.
The City and County of San Francisco encourages women, minorities and persons with disabilities to apply. Applicants will be considered regardless of their sex, race, age, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition (associated with cancer, a history of cancer, or genetic characteristics), HIV/AIDS status, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, military and veteran status, or other protected category under the law.

positionName: Data Analytics Lead Health and Wellbeing
description:
WHO ARE WE?
We are the Global Health & Wellbeing (H&W) team at Unilever. We are a start-up (less than 2 years old), focused on one of Unilever’s largest growth opportunities – the €140bn Health & Wellbeing space defined by Vitamins, Minerals, and Supplements (VMS).
We work in an agile and entrepreneurial way, collaboratively within the team and with our Unilever colleagues around the world. We work in a project based networked way where everyone needs to be able to take a step back and think strategically as well as rolling up their sleeves and get their hands dirty, to be entrepreneurial and experiment as well as bringing in the best of Unilever and work the structures of a large company, to take charge and lead as well as follow and support others.
OUR BUSINESS
Unilever’s Health & Wellbeing Group holds the company’s functional nutrition brands and the portfolio of brands that includes Equilibra (Italy) and US acquired brands Olly, LiquidIV, SmartyPants, Welly and most recently, Onnit. Each brand is completely unique and focused on giving consumers superior experiences within their respective spaces and target segments. We are committed to continue grow this strategic business for Unilever through a series of acquisitions and international expansion of acquired brands through Unilever’s scale and network in the markets.
JOB DESCRIPTION OVERVIEW
We have embarked on a mission to build a world class E-commerce marketing & analytics ecosystem and capability suite that can be leveraged across the H&W brand portfolio. The intent is to supercharge the ecommerce, digital and data capabilities of the operating companies by creating a network of external data, digital and technology partners and leverage Unilever tools to bolster the expertise and capabilities of the companies to grow exponentially. We believe data will be our differentiator as we compete with entrenched brands in the categories. Role will work closely with operating company Ecommerce, Sales, Marketing and Data VPs.
About half of all purchase decisions are digitally influenced. With the ability to link any digital moment right through to purchase in the Connected World, data becomes the key to unlocking new growth opportunities. Unilever ecommerce sales will depend heavily on influencing shoppers to start shopping online more frequently, making larger purchases and buying from a broader array of categories.
The objective of this team is to enable the business teams to create a mutually-profitable and high-growth business with ecommerce retailers.
To excel in this role, you must have passion, proven credentials of driving “data driven” growth and be able to get into the details of the analysis. You will work closely with a team of data scientists and technology teams. This is a great opportunity for someone, who wants to be a part of an aggressive data-driven growth agenda, to leverage the latest capabilities of machine learning, robotic process automations and artificial intelligence to make a big impact and leave a positive legacy.
Still interested? Great! Keep reading to learn what else makes this opportunity unique.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESCreate and manage "Performance Management" systems for Amazon , DTC and Omni customersLead innovations on data-driven investment optimization and operational efficiencyEmbed and manage smart data analytics toolsContinuously evaluate and embed data tools for H&W brandsDevelop Machine Learning solutions with external vendors and Customer Development IT teamPartner with the Global Smart Data team to leverage and contribute to learning networks
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Your mantra is “data-driven” growth: You believe that data is Unilever’s greatest asset – it drives growth, transforms companies and is the biggest bet against disruption. You will need to:
Get into the details of data, basic modelling and forecasting
Develop performance management systems (Business Intelligence) and analytics for “speed & growth”
Automate and scale with IT teams
You are passionate about ecommerce: You believe that ecommerce is not only transforming the way people shop and interact with our brands, it’s an influential media vehicle with future path-breaking capabilities
You are a self-starter: You love working with ambiguity, developing new solutions and challenging the immune systems within corporation
You love building out your own analytics “apps”: You are not happy with black boxes or check boxes – you like to create your own applications using visual analytics, modelling and technology. You love to invent, simplify and automate
You are a teacher, a guru: You can make the most complex things easy to understand and you thrive on training people on new techniques and tools
You know if it’s not real-time, it’s probably too late: You believe in process automation, assisted and predictive decision making
WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, statistics or related field (Master’s degree preferred)
A minimum of 6-8 years of experience in statistical modelling, creating analytics frameworks for retail or ecommerce
A deep understanding of the ecommerce shopper journey – demand creation through media, demand `capture, winning portfolio and demand fulfilment
Robust experience partnering with analytics agencies and ecommerce business teams to deliver analytics solutions, including data management, forecasting, optimization, predictive modelling and visualization; experience with machine learning a major plus
Good understanding of financial metrics, pricing, return on investment and promo evaluations
Working knowledge of IT data warehousing and data sources along with experience in marketing automation.
Working knowledge of digital media, search and investment optimization
Additional info
https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20190418005592/en/Unilever-to-Acquire-OLLY-Nutrition
https://www.nutritioninsight.com/news/merging-wellness-with-nutrition-unilever-expands-supplements-portfolio-with-smartypants-vitamins-acquisition.html
https://www.adweek.com/brand-marketing/liquid-iv-expands-its-flagship-product-line-after-unilever-acquisition/

company: University of California Office of the President
description:
Location: Oakland
Job ID: 24843
Job Posting


For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP


UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

UC Procurement uses strategic and collaborative sourcing methods supported by technology and data analysis to optimize spend across the UC system, creating significant savings for the University. UC Procurement partners with campus procurement teams to standardize policies, practices and agreements to make it easier to do business with the University. We develop and implement systemwide supply chain strategies and policies that leverage UC's vast purchasing power to optimize University spend.

POSITION SUMMARY

Uses skills as an experienced professional to develop, monitor, report and adjust UC Systemwide Procurement's annual budget. Facilitates budgeting processes including working with Directors and CPO to determine annual budgeting requirements; entering budget and forecast information using Oracle financials, producing quarterly and ad hoc variance reports; and providing analysis and recommendations related to department budgeting and expenditures. Manages banking relationship associated with commercial cards and the processes of receiving commercial card as well as other incentives and revenue. Problem solving ranges from strategic to tactical. Contacts are internal and external to the deparment.


Responsibilities

60%

Own budget administration for UC Systemwide Procurement. Initiate and facilitate budgeting process. Work with CPO, Chief of Staff, Directors and UC Budget Office to determine annual budgeting requirements. Use Oracle Financials and other systems to enter budget and forecast information, and to produce quarterly and ad hoc variance reports. Manage in-year budget changes and other ad-ho requests. Analyze data and make recommendations in support of department budgeting and expenditures. Develop, document and continuously improve related processes. Keep meticulous records for department use.


20%

Collaborate with UC systemwide procurement administrative functions to align budgets with invoicing and payment processes. Ensure expenses are charged to; and payment are credited to; appropriate accounts. Oversee the process of anticipating, receiving, distributing, and reporting revenue and incentives. Ensure revenue accounts are reflected in budgeting processes and decision making.


20%

Manage supplier relationship and associated reporting related to commercial card. Requires communications and collaboration with banking professionals and with contacts on each campus. Primary activities are analyzing data, producing reports, receiving and distributing incentive payments, and supporting the annual systemwide commercial card event.


Required Qualifications

Thorough knowledge of, and experience managing, budgeting practices and systems.
Proven abilty to independently gather required information; use spreadhsheets and other tools for analysis; and determine how to organize and present information and recommendations for senior leadership consumption.
Effectively present information verbally and in writing in a clear and concise manner.
Strong interpersonal skills with colleagues at various organizational levels throughout the organization; strong service orientation and critical thinking skills; and attention to detail.
Able and comfortable adapting to changing priorities.
Education

Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. A minimum of 3 years experience.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

Salary: $93,000 - $103,000

Benefits: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: Benefits of Belonging

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HOW TO APPLY

Please be prepared to attach a cover letter and resume with your application.

APPLICATION REVIEW DATE

The first review date for this job is October 18,2021. The position will be open until filled.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Background Check Process: Successful completion of a background check is required for this critical position. Background check process at UCOP

Smoke Free Work Environment: The University of California, Office of the President, is smoke & tobacco-free as of January 1, 2014. UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy

EEO STATEMENT

The University of California, Office of the President, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. EEO/AA Employer UC Nondiscrimination Policy

The University of California, Office of the President, strives to make this job board accessible to any and all users. If you have comments regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at: Accessibility or email the Human Resource Department at: epost@ucop.edu.

To apply, visit https://careerspub.universityofcalifornia.edu/psp/ucop/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_APP_SCHJOB.GBL?Page=HRS_APP_JBPST&Action=U&FOCUS=Applicant&SiteId=19&JobOpeningId=24843&PostingSeq=1

*ANNOUNCEMENT UPDATED 7/28/2021 TO REFLECT NEW CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT*

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT: All City and County of San Francisco employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. For details on how it is applicable to your employment, please click here.

San Francisco Police Department

1054 Business Analyst – Principal (Project Manager)
TEX-1054-113181
Applicants are encouraged to file immediately as this recruitment may close at any time, but no earlier than Monday, August 9, 2021.

Appointment Type:
This is a Temporary Exempt (TEX) appointment not to exceed three (3) years. This position is exempt from Civil Service Commission rules pursuant to the City and County of San Francisco, Charter Section 10.104, and incumbents are considered “at will” and serve at the discretion of the Appointing Officer.
Who We Are:
The San Francisco Police Department was established in 1849 and continually strives to become a more effective, inclusive and modern police department, while earning the trust and pride of those we serve and those who serve. Our goal is to reflect on current SFPD initiatives, assess best practices across the country, and evaluate the changing environment in policing and within the City to arrive at a strategy statement that the Department and our community can embody every day.
The San Francisco Police Department stands for Safety and Respect for All. We will engage in just transparent unbiased and responsive policing. We will do so in the spirit of dignity and in collaboration with the community. And we will maintain and build trust and respect as the guardians of Constitutional and human rights.
The San Francisco Police Department is committed to excellence in law enforcement and is dedicated to the people, traditions and diversity of our City. The department provides service with understanding, response with compassion, performance with integrity and law enforcement with vision. The department has grown into a nationally known police department providing law enforcement services to one of the most recognized cities in the United States.


Positions Description:
The San Francisco Police Department (SFPD) is seeking a proficient business analyst and experienced project manager to work in the Technology Division to perform project management and administrative aspects of the Department of Emergency Management (DEM) Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) Replacement Project. This includes meetings facilitation, requirements gathering, documentation and management, business process definitions, validating functional specifications for as-is and to-be workflows, and contract administration responsibilities for the overall project.
As a proponent of SFPD, this position supports the SFPD perspective while working in close collaboration with DEM, Department of Technology, Fire Department and numerous other departments, as the primary project manager for SFPD involving various technology systems ranging from data warehousing, mobile systems, regional data sharing, and many other critical CAD 911 system-wide integrations.
Under general direction, the CAD project manager oversees the more difficult and complex aspects of the software development life cycle, including needs analysis, cost-benefit analysis, structured systems analysis and design, feasibility analysis, technology and software assessment, and telecommunications needs analysis.
The essential responsibilities and duties for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:
Primary Liaison and Point of Contact for the SFPD to DEM for coordination of resources, access, program management, technical information, support and stakeholder communications
Advocate for the necessary SFPD tools to support operations and workflows
Collaborate with all stakeholders to build a unified, high quality public safety solution for the City and County of San Francisco
Review and gain approval for all procurement and implementation activities within the corresponding department
Support all activities to develop and maintain stakeholder project awareness, engagement, and buy-in
Hosting and managing department and cross-departmental meetings, developing agendas
Designing, developing and implementing new systems to support departmental activities setting the scope, boundaries and objectives for system functions interfaces based on departmental needs
Research and evaluate SFPD CAD systems, tools and data
Ensure department interface requirements are understood, documented, implemented and maintained for current system, during transition, and for the future systems(s)
Provide technical support to implement, test and operate a CAD system

Contribute, comment and gain approval for all CAD Replacement MOUs and contracts


Document, advocate, and support organizational process review and organizational change management related to CAD, Mobile CAD, dispatch operations and dispatch response operations.


Provide ongoing project management support and resolve problems as needed and prepare timely, accurate, and meaningful project reports for management;


Prepare test plans, documentation and training materials, and work with vendors to prepare technical specifications and scopes of work;


Establish and maintain good working relations with department personnel, staff, vendors, peers, and management;


Effectively represent the SFPD at strategic or complex customer meetings, or city events in a professional manner;


Perform related duties and responsibilities, as assigned
Minimum Qualifications
Education: An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field]. AND
Experience: Five (5) years of experience in the information systems field, including system analysis, business process design, development and implementation of business application solutions or IT project management.

Substitution: Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field.

Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.
Applicants MUST demonstrate their experience, knowledge and responsibilities described above in the employment record section of the City application.
Verification: Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at https://sfdhr.org/how-verify-education-requirements
A resume does NOT substitute for this section of the City application.
How To Apply
Applications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are only accepted through an online process. Visit www.jobaps.com/sf to register an account (if you have not already done so) and begin the application process.
Select the desired job announcement
Select “Apply” and read and acknowledge the information
Select either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered Previously”
Follow instructions on the screen
Computers are available for the public (from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday) to file online applications in the lobby of the Dept. of Human Resources at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco.
Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org, @dcyf.org, @first5sf.org).
Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received.
All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications.
Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.
If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst, Orla Petirs, by telephone at 415-837-7362, or by email at orla.petirs@sfgov.org

We hope you're interested in building a home with us. Even if you don't feel that you meet every requirement listed in this job description, we still encourage you to apply.
About the Team
You will be part of the Marketing Strategy & Operations team within the Marketing Strategy & Analytics department. Marketing Strategy & Operations supports all Williams-Sonoma, Inc. (WSI) brands through all marketing channels in audience segmentation and targeting. We analyze data, identify issues, define system requirements, develop automations, manage data-centric processes and engage with external vendors. We support CRM, Digital Marketing and Credit/Loyalty teams in any data, technology or business process automation needs that aren’t already covered by technology teams. We seek to continuously improve operational efficiencies by streamlining processes, optimizing costs and improving data quality. We serve as data interpreters and evangelists to less analytical teams by developing analyses, dashboards and visualizations.
Overview of the role
As a Data Analyst in Marketing Strategy & Operations, you will support and collaborate with CRM and Digital Marketing teams to support audience segmentation and targeting. You will support all direct mail targeting, working closely with CRM, Data Science and external vendor teams. You will work to continuously improve operational efficiency by streamlining, standardizing and automating legacy processes and tools. In addition, you will support audience segmentation and targeting across all digital channels by leveraging SQL and BI tools to produce ad hoc analysis and custom audience targeting. You may also work on Data Engineering or ETL tasks to automate and schedule data movement within the WSI network and among external partners.
Responsibilities
Be responsible for supporting CRM and Digital Marketing teams across all WSI brands, channels and programs in audience segmentation and targeting
Be responsible for analyzing and visualizing data using SQL & BI (e.g. Domo, Power BI, Tableau)
Be responsible for leveraging ETL and Data Engineering tools (e.g. Ab Initio, cron, Data Bricks, Data Factory, Domo Workbench, Tableau Prep) to automate marketing processes
Be responsible for assessing the value and quality of acquired vendor data
Be consulted for optimizing audience segmentation and targeting
May assist in campaign, audience, Product and SKU metadata management and tracking
May use data science and statistical methods (e.g. regression and correlation analysis, uplift, statistical significance) and related tools (e.g. R, Python, Data Bricks, SAS)
Criteria
Bachelor's Degree in STEM major
Ideally, 2+ years similar work experience
Strong data analysis skills, including troubleshooting
Well-organized, high attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Business process automation experience a plus
Technical Competencies required (technical Skills):
SQL experience (6+/10 scale)
Strong MS Office, especially Excel skills
Any Data Visualization or Business Intelligence (BI) tools a plus (e.g. Tableau, Domo, Power BI)
R, Python, SAS, Java, Spark, ETL, Azure, Scripting experience all a plus
Ability to perform work onsite in the San Francisco office full-time pending state, local, and Company return-to-work guidance during and after the COVID-19 pandemic.
Our Mission Around Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
We firmly believe that working in a culture focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion spurs innovation, creates healthy and high-performing teams, and delivers superior customer experiences. Our Company

About Booster

At Booster we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to clean, environmentally friendly, cost effective energy by creating the first fuel agnostic energy supply chain. We believe the adoption of alternative energies is slow because of access and we've begun to change that with our disruptive new supply platform. By delivering the right fuel to the right vehicle at the right time we create efficiency across the entire energy process. We've successfully applied this model to fossil fuels reducing carbon emissions by 1.1 lbs of CO₂ emissions with each delivery. Bio and alternative fuels are next. We're the catalyst to better energy for you, your community and our planet.

About the Role

Booster is looking for a Data Analyst to join the data team. We drive impact by collecting, organizing, and analyzing Booster's data so that we can be the best, most efficient energy delivery platform. We do this by providing accurate, actionable analysis, building sophisticated data science products, and by maintaining a reliable data infrastructure.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will leverage data and rigorous, analytical approaches to shape the future of our routing and delivery technology systems. You will work hands-on with our data scientists to understand the levers of efficiency while also helping the engineering team improve our vehicle routing algorithms. You will bring a quantitative mindset to decision-making in partnership with product, business, and operations stakeholders throughout the organization.

What You Will Be Doing

Generate ideas for exploratory analysis to shape product and model development
Leverage the modern data stack to perform intensive analysis across all areas of our marketplace to drive product development and business strategy
Instrument events and develop metrics and dashboards to monitor our performance
Contribute to experiment design and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Perform rigorous statistical analysis to understand the relationship between various marketplace factors that influence key outcomes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, and operations
Present findings to senior management to drive product decisions
Communicate analysis and decisions to high-level stakeholders and executives in verbal, visual, and written formats

What You Should Already Have

Proficiency with advanced SQL
Experience data modeling using dbt
The ability to present complex topics in a concise and actionable manner
Proficiency with python/R for data analysis and data visualization
The ability to manage stakeholder expectations and project manage design, development and delivery of data products
Proven ability to facilitate cross-functional projects that depend on the contributions of others in a variety of disciplines

About Our Benefits

Keep Everyone Healthy. We know that you work to take care of your loved ones. That's why we offer benefits that cover you and your family including 100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage for you!
Recharge Your Batteries. We have unlimited responsible PTO. Take the quality time you need, when you need it. Take care of personal stuff. Stop and smell the roses. This is a marathon, not a sprint.
Be Part of Something. Not only will you get to build something that could redefine consumer behavior, you'll be an owner. Get Early Stock Options at a fast-growing startup with strong VC backing.

description:

For more than 15 years, Amazon Web Services, AWS has been the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 200 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world—including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—to power their infrastructure. Within the AWS Sales and Marketing organization, the Specialized Sales Operations team is responsible for supporting Leadership, Sales, and Operational teams in achieving organizational objectives and driving continuous improvements in field productivity. We drive effectiveness, predictability, and deliver a “run the business” cadence that allows for the field to serve customers in the way customers want to be served.

The AWS Specialized Sales Operations team is looking for a results-oriented Data Analyst to join the WW Specialist organization and support Solution Architecture teams across the organization. You will have outstanding communication skills, proven data skills in defining, building and scaling analytical insights, strong business acumen, and an innate drive to deliver results. He/she will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and will enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Roles & Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for developing global dashboards to support WWSO SA organization and produce insights that are timely, accurate, and actionable. You will also drive operational excellence through optimization of data models.
You will work backwards from the SA leaders to gather business requirements & deliver insightful analytics solutions based on key metrics and KPIs for business.
Translate business questions into actionable & insightful dashboards, analyses & decks that are intuitive making it easy for the business stakeholders to understand how to action.
Own the development and maintenance of new and existing reporting dashboards.
You will design and implement data models using large-scale, high-volume, high-performance data to produce global intuitive self-service dashboards, visualizations and advanced analyses.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Build relationships across Amazon, working with other analytics and data teams for insights and best practice sharing.
Partner with the Business Intelligence and Data Engineering team to drive data requirements and infrastructure design decisions.
Invent & innovate through rich visualizations in Tableau/Amazon Quicksight that tell the story of business trends, patterns & outliers.
Work in a global environment.

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


5+ years of Experience in Data Analytics
2+ years of Sales Operations, Finance Analytics, Reporting and Operations or Business Intelligence
Experience presenting analytics insights to Sr. Leadership
Advanced expertise in SQL, working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or a related discipline

This position must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Charlotte, Dallas, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, Nashville, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Sunnyvale, Santa Monica, Seattle, Tempe)

location: 870 Market St Ste 1228, San Francisco, CA 94102
description:
About Us

Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and their employees. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. We are not Human Capital Management. We are not HR Software. We're tools built for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on paperwork and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data, and finance and strategy experience from Bain, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and McKinsey. Based in San Francisco and Houston, Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, and Khosla Ventures.

We are in the early stages of what we will achieve, and we're looking for a motivated self-starter in this key Business Operations role.

You

A successful Business Intelligence Analyst is a dynamic, strategic, and collaborative self-starter who believes that reliable data insights are what inform and drive decision-making at a successful company. You most likely have a data engineering or data analyst background and have a passion for data governance, cleanliness, and quality. You love working cross-functionally and enjoy tackling a wide range of challenges across product, marketing, finance, and more.

The Job

Set the standard for data quality and reliability across the company: Support company goals by ensuring that our company metrics are measurable and reportable with clean, reliable datasets. Set the standards and best practices for how we clean and transform data across different teams and functions at the company.
Become our data expert: Work cross functionally with a variety of internal customer groups and our data engineering and analyst teams to develop queryable, curated data views on top of vast granular datasets, putting data insights at the fingertips of all Homebase employees. Enable these data users even further through the creation and maintenance of a data dictionary and other guidebooks.
Scale data self-service across the company: Fully own our data visualization and self-serve platform (Looker), ensuring quality and ease of use and becoming an in-house expert that supports and evangelizes Looker adoption by the rest of the company.
Improve our data tracking processes: Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, comprehensiveness, and quality by examining causes of data discrepancies and driving scalable, technology-based solutions. Combine problem solving and sleuthing skills with business knowledge to identify root causes and resolutions for our most complicated data quality questions.

This role is a rare opportunity to have visibility across a rapidly growing startup and to play a key role in multiple projects critical to scaling the business. The size of our team and stage of our growth means you will have your hands in a variety of unique challenges, and impact the lives of millions of hourly workers.

Must-Have

Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, or related field
3-5 years as a business intelligence analyst, data engineer, data analyst, or related background with exposure to business intelligence, data warehousing, and ETL tools
Highly skilled at querying relational databases (e.g. SQL)
Experience developing LookML models in Looker strongly preferred; or, relatable experience contributing to and managing a code base for a business intelligence solution (Mode, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Detail and process oriented - we need someone meticulous to establish and maintain high data quality standards
Strong communicator capable of bridging data knowledge gaps across a company-wide audience
Gets a kick out of digging deep into data, structuring thoughts and process upfront to help deliver the best results and business outcomes
Ability to drive complex projects and processes with minimal guidance and oversight, with a bias towards action and constant prioritization
Loves finding the most customer-friendly solution to problems, bringing in both qualitative and quantitative feedback before making decisions
Proven track record for working well across teams and with external partners
Keeps a process-oriented mindset with an ability to execute projects small and large
Possesses a strong sense of urgency in line with our value of "No Day Wasted"
Loves local business… supporting them and building great tools for them

What We Offer You

Generous accrued PTO
Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
Employee 401k
Stock Options - Everyone is an owner
Fun Team Activities
A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing

At Homebase, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Homebase is an equal opportunity employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program.

Moving is one of the most universally relatable problems. Everyone’s done it - and everyone knows how frustrating and painful it can be. Updater is solving that pain at scale. We’re a well-funded and growth-focused company that helps over 25% of all households in the US move annually, and we’re growing quickly.On the Data team, our mission is to use data to improve business outcomes. We partner closely with stakeholders across the company to democratize data-driven decision-making and bring data to bear on Updater’s toughest problems. We play an active role in all major business decisions, and originate impactful initiatives that help build the next-generation moving experience we’re creating for hundreds of millions of Americans!As Senior/Lead Data Analyst, you’ll be a leader on our team focused on partnering with stakeholders across the business to facilitate core data exploration & insights, define key reporting metrics, and contribute to building and evolving the single source of truth for all business measurement components of our Data Platform! If you love building tools to democratize data, measuring business results, and using data to influence decision-making and aren’t satisfied until a project is driven to meaningful impact, we want to work with you!Learn more about our Data teamHow we built a scalable data platform architecture with Airflow and dbt (part I and part II)Updater Data and Product teams speak at Optimizely user conference about how Data and Product teams can collaborate to maximize experiment velocityPodcast on mentoring featuring Updater VP of Data Chris ByingtonUpdater partners with National Association of Realtors to provide real-time relocation insightsAbout the RoleCollaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to effectively map the most critical business areas to scalable, durable reporting and business performance measurement frameworks that will be leveraged both internally and externally as a single source of truth for stakeholders of all levels, across all departments.Amplify business growth by establishing a culture of business performance measurement excellence, and bringing your skills to bear as a critical partner in all aspects of cross-functional decision-making.Construct the core data structures that define the complex business relationships of our three-sided marketplace, and leverage them to introduce impactful views of the business that provide outsized impact for all of your cross-functional partners - enabling everything from monitoring/alerting mechanisms, to insight-dense analytical frameworks!Introduce and guide novel approaches to data modeling, self-serve reporting & analytics, and tooling to enable more efficient democratization of data across the company.Democratize data-driven decision making by arming all Updateers with the education, guidance, and tools needed to turn data into information and deploy it to maximize their impact.About YouEmpathy: you strive to see the world from your customers’ point of view in order to anticipate their needs - bonus points for being able to incept stakeholders before they themselves know what they need.Humility: you have an opinion, but aren’t afraid to be proven wrong, and are open to suggestions on what tool or technique is best to most efficiently solve a problem.Strong communication: you’re as comfortable talking with our VP of Product Operations as you are with our Director of API Engineering.Comfortable with ambiguity: you’re used to being asked open-ended questions and whittling them down to questions that can be answered by hard data.For consideration as a Senior Analyst, 3+ years (5+ years for Lead consideration) as an Analyst in a fast-paced work environment; proven ability to drive impact through analytics.Extensive knowledge of data modeling (e.g. dbt) & modern BI/reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Superset).Expert SQL skills.Bonus Points ForExperience implementing a data education program.Practical knowledge of statistics.About UpdaterUpdater makes moving easier for the 17 million households that relocate every year in the US. With Updater, users seamlessly forward mail, transfer utilities, connect TV and internet, and much more. Thousands of the most prominent real estate companies in the US (from real estate brokerages to multifamily and relocation companies) rely on Updater’s real estate products to save clients hours with a branded and personalized Updater moving experience.Headquartered in New York City, Updater has raised over $200 million from leading investors, including SoftBank Capital, IA Ventures, Commerce Ventures, Second Century Ventures (the strategic investment arm of the National Association of Realtors®), and more. Updater ranked #3 on Crain's 2016 Best Places to Work in NYC, ranking as the highest-rated tech company on the list, and ranked #7 in 2018. For more information, please visit www.updater.com.Updater is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location: Multiple Locations

location: 250 Sutter St FL 2, San Francisco, CA 94108
description:
About the role

At Chime, managing risk is extremely important. Our goal is to keep our members' accounts safe and provide them with uninterrupted access to their money while minimizing the company's financial, regulatory, and reputational exposure. As a Senior Risk Analyst on the Risk Insights team, you will play a crucial role in helping us achieve both of these goals by partnering with our Fraud, Dispute, and Compliance Operations teams to investigate suspicious signals and behaviors, identifying patterns, and creating rules to either take automated action or queue them for further review. You will partner with our Business Intelligence and Analytics teams to develop cohorts and segments, identifying the areas of highest impact to the business and constructing/iterating on dashboards that display our member's behavior in a meaningful and actionable manner. You will also work closely with our Data Science and Machine Learning teams to develop valuable data features, manage behavioral models' intake/output, and leverage model scores to achieve our goals of balancing risk with customer experience.. You'll diagnose problems and develop compelling, data-driven recommendations to minimize loss while driving growth and maintaining excellence in member experience. Come help us build the next generation of risk mitigation applications and achieve Chime's vision!

This job cannot be performed in the state of Colorado

In this role, you can expect to

Immerse yourself in our current risk, regulatory, and reputational mitigation methodologies
Partner with Fraud, Dispute, and Compliance Operations teams to design and deploy risk mitigation tactics that will enable us to identify fraudulent behavior proactively
Perform exploratory analyses on emerging fraud trends and execute advanced analysis across the Chime platform using SQL
Collaborate with our Data Science and Machine Learning teams to develop behavioral models when well-defined rules are not an optimal path to fraudulent or non-compliant trends, patterns, or behavior identification
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the various tools and data relevant to managing risk such as device fingerprinting technology, behavioral biometrics, Selfie+ID technology, digital data and information that can be extracted (e.g. HTTP User Agent, IP addresses, IP Geographic data, app session related data, etc)
Write and maintain the performance of rule sets that are referred to the Operations team's review queues, create alerts, or take automated action, including building dashboards for senior management and stakeholder review
Effectively present and communicate analyses to senior management and other stakeholders to drive business decisions
Advise and mentor your peers within Chime with an eye towards up-leveling our analytical sophistication, especially regarding risk mitigation
Assist in special projects and ad-hoc assignments upon request

To thrive in this role, you have

At least 5 years of experience in a Data Analyst role, preferably with a focus in risk mitigation
Intermediate to advanced experience in SQL, as well as experience with dashboarding tools like Looker and Tableau
Solid analytical skills and an understanding of how to utilize data to target improvements and develop solutions to problems
Proven ability of developing solutions that balance risk with providing best in-class customer experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills - you'll need to speak with, and present to, both internal stakeholders and external business partners
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, with the capability to make high-caliber decisions in real-time
Energy to work as a team toward a goal to achieve desired results
Functional programming experience with JavaScript (or Python, R, etc.) is a plus

A little about us

We created Chime because we believe everyone deserves financial peace of mind. By eliminating unnecessary fees and helping people grow their savings automatically, we've empowered millions of Americans to take control of their finances.

Chime is the largest and fastest-growing U.S. player in the challenger-banking space. Through our banking partners, we offer access to bank accounts with fee-free overdraft, provide members the chance to receive early access to their paychecks, help them improve their credit, and more!

We've built one of the most experienced leadership teams in Fintech and were recently valued at over $25.5B. We've raised over $1.7B in funding from leading investors including Sequoia Capital Global Equities, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, General Atlantic, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, DST, Coatue, Iconiq, Menlo Ventures and others.

What we offer

 Competitive salary based on experience
✨ 401k match plus the usual medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
 Quarterly stipend to spruce up your home office
 Generous vacation policy and company-wide Take Care of Yourself Days
 Virtual events to connect with your fellow Chimers- think cooking classes, music festivals, mixology classes, paint nights, etc., and delicious snack boxes, too!
 A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help create a completely new kind of banking service

We know that great work comes from great, and inclusive teams. At Chime, we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our members and helps us all grow as Chimers and individuals.

We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. Chime is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. To learn more about how Chime collects and uses your personal information during the application process, please see the Chime Applicant Privacy Notice.

Talend, a leader in data integration and data integrity, is changing the way the world makes decisions.
Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all.
Over 6,500 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is consistently recognized as a leader in its field by Forrester and Gartner.

We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.
The Senior People Analytics Analyst will collaborate across the business to uncover data-driven insights to solve business challenges across the talent lifecycle and enable transformational change. You will innovate and deliver reports and dashboards across the employee lifecycle to present complex data in a way that conveys meaningful insights. You will change the way our leaders make decisions.
Responsibilities....
Collaborate with internal partners to: identify, define, and clarify business requirements; translating needs into efficient reports and configurations that conform to standard methodologies and provide data driven insights.
Advise and understand internal stakeholders' objectives and develop appropriate data visualizations / dashboards that provide them with meaningful insights to achieve their objectives.
Utilize datasets across Workday and other applications to investigate key business trends, performance, issues, behaviors, and metrics
Build organization-wide relationships to move initiatives forward and position ideas to enhance the likelihood of success.

Facilitate review sessions with functional owners, domain specialists and end-user representatives.
Maintain the highest levels of confidentiality when gathering, sharing, mapping, and visualizing company data.
Support day-to-day queries and employee life cycle for report and in-app dashboard / analytics (e.g. FOCAL, Performance / OKRs)
Qualifications....
5+ years of professional experience in a data analyst role
Experience with Workday is a must.
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Demonstrable understanding of business requirements gathering (e.g., identifying and mapping business needs to application capabilities).
Ability to communicate data into significant items for various audiences, including but not limited to, functional end-users and executive partners.
Enjoy communicating and collaborating, and establishing positive relationships with all levels of an organization
Demonstrated customer service experience and/or good interpersonal skills.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, continually changing, business and work environment while managing multiple priorities.
Excellent understanding of Tableau to be able to link data and develop meaningful visualizations.
Knowledge of VBA, SQL, and/or R
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience with People systems such as Lever (ATS) and engagement surveys is desired
Although the role is listed as Redwood City, this role can be based anywhere in the US.

positionName: Senior Analyst, Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail
location: 415 Mission Street, 3rd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales Marketing Operations
Job Details
Are you passionate about delivering easy-to-use solutions that bridge functions and address global challenges?

Do you enjoy learning, defining, and sharing new systems and processes? Are you an organized individual, with strong communication skills that have a knack for project management? If so, the Global Field Marketing Strategy team has an opening for an Analyst, on the Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail team . This role will manage several demand generation and marketing technology platforms and processes, with an emphasis on the Direct Mail channel. This position will wear multiple hats that require a blend of both technical and non-technical skill sets. The ability to communicate effectively across several key stakeholder teams is a critical function as well as the ability to analyze data to deliver informed inputs that drive global strategy to fuel growth, pipeline, and ACV.


About the Team:

We are champions of Success for Everyone, Everywhere. As the Global Field Marketing Strategy Team, we deliver easy-to-use solutions that bridge time zones and functions, address global challenges, and develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter as one team. We combine analytics with insights to create compelling data-driven executive narratives and communications that elevate the visibility of our business success. Through globally aligned tools & technology, we rapidly scale efficiency and the impact of our teams. In all things we do, we place the customer at the center of our solutions. We actively seek out differing perspectives , leverage and build upon our global diversity, and harness best practices to bring forward global marketing solutions that accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:
Support project intake and manage users on our technology platforms, specifically for Global Direct Mail Program
Onboard and enable new, and existing users on processes and tools (in partnership with vendors)
Collaborate and manage projects across the field marketing team, regions, stakeholders, and SMEs to build marketing pipeline, accelerate selling cycles, and drive ACV
Develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter
Track project milestones and tasks across multiple teams via robust documentation
Assist in data analytics, including but not limited to the development of program metrics, attribution, and overall analytics
Work collaboratively with Operations, Compliance, Legal, and other supporting technology groups to develop process and system solutions
Support international expansion, onboarding, and enablement of our technologies
Analyze current processes and determine ways to automate, and streamline, the experience
Assist with setting up Quarterly Business Reviews with our stakeholders
Facilitate team discussions and resolve conflicts quickly
Support other Top Initiatives for the Global Field Marketing organization including Performance Steering and Tiger Team management

Required Skills/Experience:
4-5 years of Marketing Operations and Marketing Analytics experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment while remaining flexible and calm under pressure
Experience working with remote and diverse teams across regions and departments
Proficient in MS Office, Google Docs, Quip, Slack, and virtual meeting software
Preferred experience with Marketing Operations tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau CRM
Aptitude to quickly understand systems and technical concepts in order to explain to business partners
Ability to identify, share, and align around project requirements, all while staying highly organized
Self-motivated and enthusiastic with proven creative and critical thinking capabilities
Strong verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to build effective presentations and project plans
Ability to lead productive calls, identify decisions made, and clearly state action items
Experience working with Sales and Marketing is highly preferred

Sr. Business Analyst

San Mateo, CA

Extract and integrate data from multiple databases/system sources via SQL and reporting tools to support status reporting and analytical efforts related to ecommerce management, services, execution, planning and tracking. We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst who is passionate about big data and experiment design to join BitTorrent's team. Projects will span many analytics initiatives, ranging from in-app features to product marketing, pricing and more.

The ideal candidate will show a strong grasp of business models and statistics, excellent understanding of hypothesis testing, great analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to coherently describe complex mathematical concepts to a layman audience.

Key Responsibilities
Provide insights and discovery on a variety of dataset across the business.
Serve as the data and analytics domain expert, evangelizing data literacy and building a suite of tools to empower the team to make data-informed decisions: dashboards, reports, ad-hoc queries, insightful observations
Own and run A/B/m experiments
Provide support and expertise to Product Managers in defining KPIs and technical data requirements to ensure all product features and initiatives launch with proper metric tracking.
Deliver data and data analysis on an ad-hoc basis using whatever tools are necessary for the task
Measure network performance in one of the world's largest distributed applications.
Key Skills
BS required, ideally in a relevant field to analytics (engineering, information systems, math, science, etc).
2-5 years of professional experience as a Senior Analyst
Strong SQL capabilities - experience querying data from relational DB engines.
Solid programming skills in Python or R, or other data analytics programming languages.
Knowledge and experience in A/B testing - know about statistical test, bayesian inference.
Experience with a Business Intelligence Dashboards tool (Tableau, Google Data Studio, Superset, or similar)
Strong written and verbal communication skills - be able to take complex math and analytical concepts and explain to working teams and client executives.
Bonus!
Experience with the big data technology stack (HDFS, MapReduce, Spark, Hive) and big data processing
Experience with MapReduce using Hadoop or Spark
Knowledge in machine learning algorithms such as linear/logistic-regression, Neural-Networks and others would be a strong plus.
Experience with AWS tools/services is a big plus!!

At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes.
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for providing complex analytical data gathering and research, interpretation, reporting, and policy/procedure development at the enterprise and divisional levels. The incumbent's responsibilities include documenting, providing analysis of business impacts, developing case scenarios for new or enhanced systems, and analyzing, testing, and assisting in the implementation of workflow and process maps. The Senior Business Analyst provides recommendations for resolution of complex operational issues and assists in day-to-day system and user administration. The incumbent will also be responsible for the development and on-going maintenance of divisional/enterprise financial, costing, and productivity models.
How you will make an impact:
Provides process improvement and project leadership for divisional and enterprise projects.
Acts as business system lead for divisional inventory of process maps and workflows, developing and deploying tactical solutions to solve business issues at both divisional and enterprise levels.
Participates in the development, documentation, and management of project plans including requirements gathering, design, risk analysis, testing, implementation and maintenance.
Transforms data into impactful business insights, strategy recommendations and implementation plans to improve key performance metrics for the business.
Gathers information from internal and external stakeholders to document business, process, functional, and/or data requirements.
As part of project plan design and management, performs dependency analysis, functional design review, workflow analysis, use case analysis, and data and process modeling.
Prepares and plans all aspects of the Requirements discipline, including controlling or participating in estimating, feasibility analysis, meeting facilitation, management and executive reporting, change request management, issue tracking, and process improvements.
Develops and maintains divisional/enterprise financial, costing, and productivity models.
Analyzes, researches and resolves complex issues relating to client enrollment.
Creates technical documentation for enrollment systems for internal and external users as well as conduct end user training.
Builds the foundation for enrollment projects by capturing the business needs- problem definition, current state definition, objectives, business case, desired future state definition.
This list is not all-inclusive and you are expected to perform other duties as requested or assigned.
What we look for:
4+ years of experience w/Bachelor’s degree
Expert knowledge and experience with financial, process and data-driven structured analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to evaluate business processes and recommend effective solutions.
Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly while maintaining excellent attention to detail.
Ability to interact with all levels of personnel and communicate clearly in a professional manner.
Working knowledge of SQL, Visio, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Benefits and perks:
12 days starting vacation, 12 holidays, 9 sick days and your birthday off!
Low-cost premium medical insurance options
100% paid dental and vision insurance
Generous 401(k) matching and flat contribution

In conjunction with functional leaders, create performance reports for each department

If you consider yourself to be self-motivated, detail-oriented and great at solving ambiguous problems, we want to hear from you.

Must Have
2-5 years’ experience as a Salesforce Business Analyst/Administrator.Salesforce Sales Cloud certification and hands on experience with configuration.Salesforce Certified Administrator or Developer required.Experience gathering requirements and building custom Salesforce applicationsBroad understanding of CRM Best PracticesExperience with Service cloud
