Advertised: October 15, 2021 (9:00 AM) Pacific Daylight Time
Applications close: October 14, 2022 (11:55 PM) Pacific Daylight Time

About Good Eggs
Good Eggs delivers absurdly fresh groceries, easy weeknight meal kits, pantry staples, and alcohol straight to your door. We are pioneering a better way for people to feed their family, without settling. We believe good food is the most powerful force for change: For our families, our farmers, our employees, and our environment.
About the Role
Fresh off closing a $100M round of funding and adding some amazing new leaders like our CMO Vineet Mehra (former CMO at Walgreens Boots Alliance) and COO Kiran Vinta (former Head of Expansion for Uber Eats), we’re excited to put our focus on accelerating customer-centric growth both in the Bay Area and via an expansion to other regions later this year.
We have to continue to evolve our data driven decision support to complement our ever growing company and enable leaders to navigate through complexity of additional fulfillment centers and geographic regions, all while improving our data accuracy and usability to provide actionable business insights.
As a Sr. Data Analyst, you'll be responsible for driving GoodEggs’ success by leading analytics efforts to drive conversion and optimize our marketing efficiency. You will also contribute towards ongoing learnings around Marketing channel/budget optimization through Multi Touch Attribution and MMM by building a reporting framework to enable the marketing team to make data driven decisions on a regular basis. In our quest to personalize experience for our customers you will also be delivering insights and recommendations around demographics in addition to user behavior
About the Technology Organization
Our technology organization, composed of Application Engineering, Platform Engineering, Customer Science & Analytics, and IT, is undergoing significant growth. We run a mature agile process, including continuous deployment (automated tests not QA), a culture of DevOps (end-to-end ownership of your code), pair programming, and regular retrospectives. Nobody likes tech debt, so we both empower developers to refactor as they go and also elevate large refactors to the company roadmap level.
Our StackMode Analytics BI toolSnowflake Data WarehouseDagster Orchestration FrameworkDBT (Data build tool)Segment (CDP)
- Skills - Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Python
Responsibilities
Lead Various analytics projects across all marketing channels to deliver insights and recommendations on who/where/how to target different customer segments.
Partner with the lifecycle team to measure the impact of the program on customer behavior and value
Clearly communicate insights and recommendations to business stakeholders.
Build dashboards and reporting to enable self-serve analytics(Mode & Amplitude)
Perform Ad hoc analysis to promote understanding of customer behavior (eg. funnel analysis, data mining, surveys, etc.); make actionable recommendations.
Lead A/B testing pipeline and analytics: Establish testing priorities, build success metrics, validate implementation, ensure statistical significance, monitor results across KPIs
Use excellent technical skills to access information from various structured and unstructured data sources
Initiate and drive data projects, writing clear requirements for our Data Modeling teams
Partner closely with the data science team to enable the development of best in class data science models
Required Qualifications
Interest and belief in our mission of good food being the most powerful force for change
Desired 3-5 years of experience in marketing analytics with deep understanding of marketing KPIs
Proficient in SQL is a must
Proficient in Snowflake is preferred
Proficient in Mode Analytics a plus
Strong business communication skills; able to write/speak clearly and professionally for a variety of audiences
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated, energetic, "can-do" attitude in a fast-moving environment.
Ability to deal with change and ambiguity with a bias for action.
Degree, certification, or relevant experience in data analytics. Masters in Computer Science or equivalent.
Plus experience in some of the following areas:
Python
Advanced visualization concepts
Snowflake or other cloud based data warehouses
Why work for Good Eggs?
Work for a purpose-driven companyAn incredible work environment with passionate, diverse, and accomplished team membersBenefits include employer-assisted health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, 401k, flexible spending accounts (FSA), 20% off groceries, Flex vacation + 10 holidays, generous parental leave, & the opportunity for an unpaid sabbatical after 2 years.Meaningful equity is provided to all employeesThe opportunity to work for a pioneering company in a trillion dollar market that is quickly shifting onlineGuidance from an all-star board including Bill Gurley (Benchmark Capital, #2 on the Midas List), Danny Rimer (Index Ventures), Chuck Templeton (Managing Director of S2G Ventures and founder of Open Table), and Vishal Vasishth (Obvious Ventures).
Good Eggs provides equal employment opportunities for team members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military status or disability in accordance with local, state and federal guidelines. Data organization and management skills. Technical expertise with data models, data import methodologies, database design development, and data mining; preferred experience with a BI tool

positionName: Senior Analyst, Storefront Advanced Analytics & Insights
description:
Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics & Insights

Wayfair Analytics is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Advanced Analytics & Insights team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.

At their core, the Advanced Analytics & Insights team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.

What You’ll Do:

Construct optimized code that massages information from multi-terabyte data sources including sales, clickstream, logistics, product, and customer databases to deliver business insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with all facets of the organization including product management, engineering, and creative design to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth.
Become the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing for your area to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and consumer behavior.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Perform deep-dive analysis, including the application of advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems.
Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses in Looker and GBQ to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner.

What You Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
1+ years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.
Experience in leveraging modeling algorithms to derive business insights.
Experience with experimental test design such as A/B testing.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI); experience with Looker a plus.
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ecommerce or retail analytics experience a plus

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

MetricStream is the global market leader for Integrated Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) solutions delivered on an intelligent integrated platform. MetricStream’s purpose-built platform is proven with over a million global users, designed to serve GRC use cases across industries and powered by deep domain expertise, embedded content, rich context, integrated data, and explainable AI. Since 2001, MetricStream has empowered organizations to intuitively harness front-line intelligence that enables all stakeholders to make real-time risk-aware business decisions.

Sr. Business Analyst

We are looking for a dynamic individual with an ability to define, analyze and document requirements in the context of MetricStream Application Implementation Projects, to help develop technical solutions to customers' business problems

Key Responsibilities

Possess ability to define, analyze and document requirements in the context of MetricStream Application Implementation Projects, to help develop technical solutions to customers' business problems
Take the lead in the following (but not limited to): Assisting with the business case, requirements analysis, translating and simplifying requirement, requirement management and communication, Configuration of the MetricStream’s applications, etc.
Interact with MetricStream’s Account Managers and Product Management regarding application features and functionality
Create requirements document, functional specifications, test plan and test cases
Understand the configuration aspects of the various MS modules and setup the modules
Translate the functional requirements from the customer into design
Communicate solutions to the client in business context and terminology, and to the internal delivery teams from a system perspective
Practice and help enforce best practices for software development within the team
Prepare test scenarios and undertake the functional validation of a solution before delivery to the customer
Review and approve test cases prepared by the QA organization
Lead and guide a team of application developers, help them understand the business requirements and develop applications and / or configured solutions
Review Application User Guides and training material for MetricStream’s customers
Skills and Experience

10+ years in software applications development
Possess experience working as a functional consultant in one of the top ERP solutions (Oracle, SAP, Peoplesoft, etc.), preferably in the Manufacturing and Financial domains
Experience with customer interaction, requirements gathering, and software development lifecycle a must
Experience using Waterfall, Agile and Hybrid methodologies, and associated tool sets
Familiarity with the business processes of at least one of the verticals like Automotive, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare or Retail a plus
Strong communication (verbal and written) and project management skills
Possess hands-on approach
Education

Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering/Business or Computer Applications

MetricStream is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We not only celebrate diversity, we thrive on it. We are committed to creating an all-inclusive workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, genetic information, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by local, state or federal laws. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

positionName: Senior Analyst ll, Growth Product Analytics
location: 250 Sutter St FL 2, San Francisco, CA 94108
description:
About the role

We're hiring a Senior Data Analyst who will focus on growth for the Pay Friends product, which allows our members to instantly transfer funds to both other Chime members and non-members. Through experimentation, user funnel analysis, data science modeling, and dashboard development, you will surface product insights and recommendations that will increase trialing, repeat usage, and advocacy of the Pay Friends product.

In this role, you will work closely with growth product managers, engineers, marketers, and researchers to foster our data-driven product development culture and inform our product roadmaps and create a deep understanding of member behavior.

This job cannot be performed remotely in the state of Colorado.

In this role, you can expect to

Define key metrics used to measure the success of our products and member growth.
Build a deeper understanding of user behaviors in all stages of the member lifecycle, from enrollment through to retention, and identify the corresponding business opportunities for Chime.
Partner with product, engineering, marketing, research, and design to translate your data insights into features.
Lead experimentation by providing guidance on the experiments that should be run, how they should be run, and evaluating our key metrics' impact.
Foster a data-driven, test-and-learn culture with your passion for telling stories with data.

To thrive in this role, you have

A quantitative degree in a field like Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or Engineering. Advanced degrees preferred.
5+ years in analytics. B2C product analytics and FinTech experience preferred.
Strong SQL skills - familiarity with window functions would be a good sign.
Data science and modeling skills - optimizing features and driving model performance.
Experience with a scripting language like Python or R.
Experience building metric frameworks to understand user behaviors.
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis used to guide decision making.
Excellent communication skills, a record of working cross-functionally to achieve results.

A little about us

We created Chime because we believe everyone deserves financial peace of mind. By eliminating unnecessary fees and helping people grow their savings automatically, we've empowered millions of Americans to take control of their finances.

Chime is the largest and fastest-growing U.S. player in the challenger-banking space. Through our banking partners, we offer access to bank accounts with fee-free overdraft, provide members the chance to receive early access to their paychecks, help them improve their credit, and more!

We've built one of the most experienced leadership teams in Fintech and were recently valued at over $25.5B. We've raised over $1.7B in funding from leading investors including Sequoia Capital Global Equities, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, General Atlantic, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, DST, Coatue, Iconiq, Menlo Ventures and others.

What we offer

 Competitive salary based on experience
✨ 401k match plus the usual medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
 Quarterly stipend to spruce up your home office
 Generous vacation policy and company-wide Take Care of Yourself Days
 Virtual events to connect with your fellow Chimers- think cooking classes, music festivals, mixology classes, paint nights, etc., and delicious snack boxes, too!
 A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help create a completely new kind of banking service

We know that great work comes from great, and inclusive teams. At Chime, we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our members and helps us all grow as Chimers and individuals.

We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. Chime is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. To learn more about how Chime collects and uses your personal information during the application process, please see the Chime Applicant Privacy Notice.

Director - Data Analytics
Job Description
CoStar Group is hiring a Director of Analytics in our San Francisco office to drive improvements in customer growth and engagement by analyzing, measuring, and recommending solutions through data. This exciting opportunity will propel the growth of CoStar Group’s business for sale brands including BizBuySell.com, BizQuest.com, and FindaFranchise.com. In this role you will manage existing data resources, implement new technologies and tooling to further enable the analytics function, and develop and deploy scalable data sharing practices. You will bring significant experience in analytics, product KPIs, goal setting, experimentation, and reporting, and split your time between hands on development and managerial activities. You will own data environments and oversee the development of new processes that support teams across the business for sale marketplace. You will collaborate with other product, engineering, and data leaders to improve the business by leveraging data modeling, testing platforms and data visualization. We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how entrepreneurs navigate through the business ownership lifecycle, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyze large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations. The ideal candidate will have outstanding communication skills, proven data infrastructure design and implementation capabilities, strong business acumen, and an innate drive to deliver results. He/she will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and will enjoy working in a dynamic environment. Responsibilities: Develop analytical solutions that help achieve business objectives, and identify and report on the KPI’s that will determine success. Perform proactive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, insights and develop strategies. Collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, sales, etc.) to evaluate opportunities that deliver business goals via data analysis, predictive models, and machine learning. Share results and conclusions you draw to derive meaning from the data, and what business actions you think should be taken as a result of the analysis. Improve upon data collection and upkeep of our datasets. Own the architecture and integrity of our data tracking and reporting systems. Create and maintain shareable standardized reporting using data visualization tools for the KPIs needed by the business. Design and analyze A/B and Multivariate tests. Coordinate across departments and with our analytics providers to establish best practices and adhere to common design patterns, and work through your plans with others to troubleshoot potential issues upfront. Manage a team of 2-3 analysts, coach, and mentor them to achieve their full potential. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor or Master's Degree required in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, or related field 7+ years of relevant work experience including 3+ years managing analytics and data science teams. Exceptional data analysis skills and the ability to identify actionable insights from large datasets Advanced Excel and modelling skills Deep experience with distilling complex analyses into clear findings for relevant stakeholders and providing applicable business insights and recommendations. Proficient in SQL, writing queries, and reporting from relational databases. Experience with SQL Server Management Studio. Advanced understanding with web analytics and tag management (i.e. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, FullStory, Google Tag Manager, and more) Experience with data warehousing systems like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery Strong scripting and programming skills with Python, R, etc. with hands-on experience, preferably in Microsoft related technologies. Good, applied statistics skills, such as distribution analysis, probability theory, statistical testing, regression, etc. Expertise in running exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling and data mining. Experience with designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests and Multivariate tests). Experience with data visualization tools, such as PowerBI and Tableau. Impeccable attention to details and never compromising attitude for data accuracy. Ability to run automated jobs to manipulate and store data from APIs and various cloud providers. Join the CoStar Team Join the team that creates CoStar’s winning technology. If you’re a data science enthusiast, you have an incredible opportunity at CoStar – named one of Forbes’ Most Innovative Growth Companies for four consecutive years. We’re always looking for talent to help build the tools and analytics that harvest our big data and power our research operations and shape the marketplaces that serve tens of millions of people each month. Our culture of innovation and excellence attracts and encourages the best and brightest in a broad range of disciplines, which makes CoStar a fun and supportive place to work. What We Offer You work hard to connect with our customers and website users every day. As part of your total rewards package, CoStar is committed to offering you valuable health, wellness and financial benefits to support you and your family, both now and in the future. At CoStar, we help our clients succeed by providing the most cutting-edge, reliable information and tools in the business. And we want our employees to succeed too. We strive to hire the best talent and reward you with top-notch, market-leading pay, benefits and career opportunities. As an example of our commitment to excellence, CoStar ranks in the 90th percentile of employers who offer competitive and affordable medical plans. CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the Unites States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. Company Overview CoStar Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSGP) is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. Founded in 1987, CoStar conducts expansive, ongoing research to produce and maintain the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availabilities. LoopNet is the most heavily trafficked commercial real estate marketplace online. Realla is the UK's most comprehensive commercial property digital marketplace. BizBuySell is the most heavily trafficked business for sale marketplace online with over 3 million visits across our network. Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Westside Rentals, AFTER55.com, CorporateHousing.com, ForRentUniversity.com, Cozy and Apartamentos.com form the premier online apartment resource for renters seeking great apartment homes and provide property managers and owners a proven platform for marketing their properties. CoStar Group's websites attracted an average of approximately 50 million unique monthly visitors in aggregate in the third quarter of 2018. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe and Canada with a staff of over 3,600 worldwide, including the industry's largest professional research organization. #LI-VP1
CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Checkr's mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $4.6B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include, Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

The Checkr Business Intelligence team is the center of excellence for Business analytics across the company and is responsible for cultivating a data-driven culture by supporting internal teams and customers with high-quality data and insights. We are looking for someone to join our team to help us drive better business outcomes by providing actionable reporting & analytics products!

As a Senior BI Analyst - Finance Analytics, you are responsible for partnering with finance teams across the organization to understand their analytics needs, analyze data and assist with automated reports and dashboards on Checkr's business intelligence (BI) platform. Gather requirements, analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders with an eye for what drives business performance. Develop data models from large data sets in Checkr's data warehouse to help automate reporting and drive adoption and effective use of BI within every team.

Responsibilities
Understanding of finance/accounting processes and data with experience implementing finance-based BI dashboards and analytics tools
Analyse data from multiple sources, identify gaps, reconcile conflicts, and process metrics and details to drive decision-making. Provide guidance to Finance business partners in constructing metrics and analysis.
Collaborate with other analysts, and work cross-functionally with product, engineering, and finance teams to build a data-driven culture across the company
Be proactive in identifying improvements to existing reporting and dashboarding infrastructure to accurately represent the current company goals
Work cross-functionally to ensure data consistency across product, finance, and go-to-market teams to streamline workflows and deliver reliable reporting
Work across teams and promote productive relationships (business, modeling, technology & governance) to improve clarity and ensure that processes are as streamlined as possible.

What you bring:

5+ years of experience working as a data professional
Advanced SQL skills for analysis, standardizing queries, and building data infrastructure involving large-scale relational datasets
Strong experience developing, deploying, and maintaining of enterprise level reports using BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or other relevant technologies
Experience with MPP databases such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or other relevant technologies
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners
Experience with scripting languages like Python, Shell, JavaScript, HTML is a plus.
Knowledge of Finance, FP&A and Sales processes and applications (NetSuite, Salesforce, etc.) is a plus
Familiar with PM methodologies (e.g., Agile, Kanban, etc.) and knowledge of when to apply methodologies.
Ability to mentor lower level developers on definitive tasks.

What you get:

A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance.

Lightning, Field Service, Visualforce, Apex experience is a plusData management capabilities.Agile experience a plus

Role Description:
Work with clients and end users to gather, understand and define business requirementsAssist with ongoing system administration including but not limited to: creating and modifying Users, Fields, Validation Rules, Workflows, Automated Alerts, Field Updates, Page Layouts, Data Integrity standards and practices and Security functionalityCreate customized reports and dashboards to visualize key business metricsMaintain database integrity and accuracy via data cleansing, data uploads and data exportsAssist with release evaluations including defining scope and priorities for system initiativesMaintain all system documentation and SFDC policies/proceduresTroubleshoot production issues in a timely manner and provide internal support when neededWork with end users during User Acceptance Testing (UAT) & regression testing to accurately prioritize defects and re-test resolved issuesOversee integrated business applications and ensure they functionUnderstand how Salesforce integrates with our other CRM solutions and customer/business intelligence databases
Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment.
Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini.
Applications Consultants have expertise in a specific technology environment. They are responsible for software-specific design and realization, as well as testing, deployment and release management, or technical and functional application management of client-specific package based solutions (e.g. SAP, ORACLE). These roles also require functional and methodological capabilities in testing and training.
Required Skills and Experience:
You are learning and developing the knowledge, technical skills and core consulting behaviors required to succeed in Application Services. You learn an appropriate methodology and acquire knowledge of a business domain and a Package Based Solution. You demonstrate flexibility and versatility in meeting objectives and should be able to manage your workload and update management on task progress. You should already demonstrate progressing skills in building solutions and in optimizing and improving a client’s applications and systems.
Qualification: Minimum 1-3 years experience, Bachelor’s Degree.
Should have progressing skills in Package Configuration.
Should have baseline skills in Business Analysis, Business Knowledge, Testing, Architecture Knowledge, Technical Solution Design and Vendor Management.

Description
At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day
First Republic Private Wealth Management is comprised of investment management, brokerage, trust, financial planning and insurance professionals. We offer customized wealth management solutions for our clients from a wide array of services including comprehensive investment management, financial planning, estate planning, trust services, endowment management and more. Our goal is to understand our clients' unique needs and support them throughout a lifetime of financial goals.

Responsibilities
We are looking to hire an Investment Grade Municipal Fixed Income Credit analyst to join the Fixed Income Credit Group within First Republic Investment Management. The role requires performing fundamental research on municipal bond issuers, along with related credit monitoring functions for the Fixed Income Group. Research is both qualitative and quantitative in nature. Work product includes written pieces, statistical analysis, modeling, as well as periodic reporting. The analyst will work with trading and portfolio managers to understand the core risks and relative value opportunities associated with municipal debt issuers.
What you'll do as Municipal Credit Analyst:
Analyze investment grade municipal credits in multiple sectors for trading and portfolio managers and as part of ongoing surveillanceInterpret market and policy developments and their impact on holdings and sectors; analyst should be able to identify macro issues and assess the effects on individual holdingsPromptly respond to trader and portfolio manager requests with quick but thorough analysisConduct portfolio credit reviews; coordinate with portfolio managers and fixed income traders on credit-related sell recommendationsIdentify relative value opportunities and contribute to trade idea generationParticipate in the process to build and maintain financial models; the analyst will work with our technology and compliance colleagues to comply with best practicesPrepare monthly "Credit Committee" materials and participate in presentation to larger Fixed Income group and Investment Management Research audienceProduce white papers and other timely research for both internal and external distribution to broad list of portfolio managers and banker

Qualifications
You could be a great fit if you have:
Bachelor's degree, preferably with a focus on public finance, accounting, or economics (MBA, MPA or CFA preferred)Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skillsMinimum of 2-5 years of experience as a credit analyst at a ratings agency or buy side firm or other relevant investment experienceExcellent writing skills and analytical abilitiesA demonstrated ability to work as part of a team with a high level of integrityDesire to provide extraordinary service and further First Republic Bank's culture and values
Desired Skills:
Bloomberg and Perform/Credit Scope experienceSome basic knowledge of ESG analysisKnowledge of VBA, SQL is advantageous
The successful candidate will have:
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multi-taskExcellent communication skills, both written and verbalKnowledge in economics, finance, and capital markets; basic knowledge of fixed income securitiesA positive attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit; a willingness to take on a variety of projects and see them through to completionA strong attention to detail, sound judgment and ability to reasonIntellectual curiosity to enhance credit skills across multiple taxable sectors and securitiesAbility to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities under pressureAbility to quickly process and analyze large amounts of informationAbility and willingness to work both independently and in a team environmenta nd positively contribute toward a culture of collaborationAbility to interact and build relationships with people of varied backgrounds, personalities and levels of seniority
Job Demands:

Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficientMust be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way.

positionName: Senior Business Analyst: Oracle Fusion Cloud (Procure to Pay)
description:
Company Description
Company Description
Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary blood tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. The Guardant Health Oncology Platform leverages capabilities to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs across all stages of the cancer care continuum. Guardant Health has launched liquid biopsy-based Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients. These tests fuel development of its LUNAR program, which aims to address the needs of early stage cancer patients with neoadjuvant and adjuvant treatment selection, cancer survivors with surveillance, asymptomatic individuals eligible for cancer screening and individuals at a higher risk for developing cancer with early detection.

Job Description
Guardant Health Inc. is looking for an experienced Oracle Supply Chain Business Analyst to own the Oracle ERP Cloud technology solution to meet the need of our internal business departments. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to work with internal business stakeholders to define our future system roadmap.
Primary Responsibilities:
Work very closely with Procurement, Accounting & Supply chain teams to understand business requirements and then partner closely with IT development team for creation of Business Requirements, Functional Designs
Leverage business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvements
Maintain and support Oracle Fusion Cloud production environment for the Procurement to Pay and Costing business flows
Configure and support Procurement to Pay and Costing Modules
Build proof-of-concept (POC) for potential new solutions
Manage relationships with multiple business teams for new solution features and technical support
Coordinate with end-users and other stakeholders to ensure timely and accurate performance of the production environment supporting Procurement, Costing
Take ownership to set up and configure application, when necessary, participate in testing during system upgrades
Work closely with the integration team to troubleshoot and solve any data related issues during daily operations.
Develop future solution strategies by working closely with Business and IT Development teams
Create and present functional design including data analysis to business team and gather feedback to influence solution design and approach
Manage intake process with end-users for assessment and prioritization of new requests, and track through to completion
Facilitate meetings to capture requirements, review scope, collate estimates to create release plans and delivery schedules, conduct post-implementation reviews
Document functional business requirements, process flow diagrams, and business cases
Facilitate review sessions with functional owners and end-user representatives
Perform gap analysis as is vs. to be
Participate in end-to-end implementation planning including stakeholder management, project management, issue management, communication, and change management
Writing and reviewing QA and UAT test scripts
Managing UAT with end users including coordination and user acceptance signoff
Preparation of user documentation and training documentation as necessary
Engage in change control procedures, representing application changes within multi-stakeholder governance
Understand Guardant Health business models and work closely with end-users to identify, recommend, and implement business process improvements
Perform as a core team member and/or participate in ERP project initiatives at times
Document systems procedures to facilitate cross-training

Qualifications
Knowledge and Experience:
Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of on experience in Oracle EBS R11/R12/Fusion ERP in Procurement to Pay and Costing Modules
Solid functional knowledge of Procurement, Costing, Payables with minimum 3+ years of hand-on experience on Oracle Fusion Cloud
Quality Management experience will be a plus.
Must have 8+ years of experience implementing/Supporting medium/large scale Oracle ERP SCM modules
Basic understanding of SQL, OTBI & BI Publisher reports
Ability to interact with all levels of business users (end-users/executives)
Working knowledge of end-to-end business processes as regards to Procurement to Pay and Costing
Minimum 6 years of experience preparing as-is process documentation, to-be process documentation, and performing detailed gap analysis
Demonstrated ability to have successfully completed multiple, complex technical projects
Demonstrated experience in project conceptualization and planning
Capture user stories and translate into release plans across single or multiple development sprints, scrum master or equivalent certification a plus
Producing analyses from multiple data sources to inform decisions on business process improvements or technical decisions
Data migrations to new solutions, and decommissioning of legacy systems
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise professional manner, tailored to the appropriate audience, including both verbal and written communications
Ability to lead and work collaboratively within a business unit team and have strong influencing skills
Must be able to manage multiple priorities and complex tasks in a dynamic work environment
Must have experience preparing end-user documentation and conducting end-user training
Excellent communication skills with the ability to impart ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Good working knowledge skills with Microsoft Office Products, Microsoft Visio, and Microsoft Project
Highly motivated and driven, with keen attention to detail and the ability to multitask in a self-managed environment
Customer-centric and Service minded
Ability to develop documentation for training and user procedures
Project Management experience a plus
Working with outsourced support vendors, including offshore within Asia time zones.
Prior experience within Healthcare sector would be a plus
Proven ability to create, socialize and implement plans for project activities such as data migration and UAT
An ability to articulate and clearly communicate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical, and impactful manner.
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a high-pressure on-call environment with changing priorities
Personal Attributes:
Collaborative spirit and focus on finding win-win solutions
Customer service oriented with a focus on a quality end-user and stakeholder experience
Able to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure fast paced environment
Excellent and timely communication skills and strong interpersonal and presentation skills
Flexible during times of change and able to interact tactfully with a variety of personalities.
Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with end-users and co-workers
Additional Information
Employee may be required to lift routine office supplies and use office equipment. Majority of the work is performed in a desk/office environment; however, there may be exposure to high noise levels, fumes, and biohazard material in the laboratory environment. Ability to sit for extended periods of time.
Guardant Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
To learn more about the information collected when you apply for a position at Guardant Health, Inc. and how it is used, please review our Privacy Notice for Job Applicants.

About Upstart

Upstart is a leading AI lending platform partnering with banks and credit unions to expand access to affordable credit. As we transitioned to being a public company, we’re now poised to leverage our domain expertise and revolutionize every aspect of lending and credit risk evaluation. We’ve recently expanded our offerings to include automobile refinancing and we plan to take on more verticals as the business grows.

By leveraging Upstart's AI platform, Upstart-powered banks and credit unions can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. Upstart's patent-pending platform is the first to receive a no-action letter from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau related to fair lending. Upstart not only supports a large remote workforce, but also has offices in San Mateo, CA; Columbus, OH; and Austin, TX.

Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we’d love to hear from you!

The Team

The Data Analytics team plays the critical role of providing analytical support across Upstart's organization to enable data-driven decision making. We leverage our analytical and technical skills to help our partners with a multitude of services, some of which include understanding our underwriting models and presenting on trends in our loan performance, analyzing market size opportunities, creating financial models, developing our business intelligence pipeline to enable self-service reporting, and architecting/automating of work processes.

Our team prioritizes having fun first. We value candidates who enjoy actively contributing to conversations. We believe that seeing the human in others allows us to work more cohesively and to safely challenge each other. A happy team is a performing team.

The Role

As the Data Analytics Manager, Accounting at Upstart, you will own and scale data reporting in support of our Accounting team. You will be a critical member of Upstart’s analytics team that develops and automates our business critical financial reports, collaborates with Product and Engineering to implement reporting process improvement, and ensures our reporting processes are SOX compliant. Through your efforts, we’ll be able to ensure reporting accuracy and consistency across the company to monitor and report loan performance. If you are naturally curious, love data, and can communicate complex concepts with technical and non-technical people, this could be a great opportunity for you.

Position Location - This role is available in the following locations: Remote, San Mateo (#LI-REMOTE)

Time Zone Requirements - This team operates on the West Coast time zone.

Travel Requirements - This team has regular on-site collaboration sessions. These occur 3 days per Month at the San Mateo office. If you need to travel to make these meetups, Upstart will cover all travel related expenses.

How you’ll make an impact:
Partner with Accounting, Audit, Product, and Engineering teams to define, develop, and support our monthly financial reporting.
Own data reporting process, proactively identify data quality and integrity issues that affect the accuracy of reporting.
Operates as a subject matter expert on financial modeling and financial impact analysis in relation to the fair value estimation of Upstart’s loan assets, servicing rights, and Asset Backed Securities.
Provide hands-on technical leadership to identify, research, interpret, catalog, source, manipulate, and enrich Upstart’s structured and unstructured data assets to facilitate effective analytics. Develop subject matter expertise in domain, analytic and data assets.
Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret business information and the key metrics that measure loan performance.
Create reports and dashboards in BI tools such as Looker. Monitor trends in relevant metrics and report on key insights on a daily basis.
Work with various big data platforms, databases and systems such as AWS, Redshift and other big data technologies.
Participate in data modeling and architecture discussion, influence data products roadmap, and take ownership and responsibility of new projects.
Work closely with engineering teams to ensure quick turnaround on fixes. Take ownership of communicating changes to the appropriate end-users.
Work with data service providers to explore APIs, analyze and forecast the impact of integrating new data sets. Work with Engineering throughout the entire process of on-boarding new data sets.

What we’re looking for:
Minimum requirements:
BS/MS Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or other highly quantitative/analytical field
5+ years of professional experience performing data analytics that influence business decision making
Strong communication with client-facing and executive level data presentation skills
Industry experience with focus on capital markets, finance, or accounting
Experience creating financial models using tools like Excel and Google Sheets
Experience in leading a team of analysts and leading large, cross-functional projects
Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment
Experience in data analytics tools such as Python or R and BI/reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI
Organized and able to juggle multiple tasks while still meeting deadlines

Preferred qualifications:
Previous consumer marketplace lending industry experience
Experience with Amazon Redshift and SQL querying
Experience in project management & documentation using tools such as Jira and Confluence

What you’ll love:
Competitive Compensation (base + bonus & equity)
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
Personal Development and Technology & Ergonomic Budgets
Life insurance and disability benefits
Clubs and Activities (Game Nights, Fitstarters, Superwomen, Book Club, Investing Club, Money Discussions, Photography Club and Basketball teams)
Generous vacation policy
401(k) and Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Catered lunches + snacks & drinks

Upstart is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to ensuring that underrepresented classes receive better access to affordable credit, and are just as committed to embracing diversity and inclusion in our hiring practices. We celebrate all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and know that we can only become better together.

Summary of Major Responsibilities:

The Senior Technical Business Analyst/Product Owner is an active thought partner who contributes to shaping the technology demand among the Exact Sciences business community. This position will partner closely with cross-functional team members to define Exact Sciences value-driven information technology (IT) solutions. This role collaborates with stakeholders, IT business solutions, enterprise platforms, and application developers to collect, maintain, and prioritize the software product backlogs. This position will work with development teams to define user stories, acceptance criteria, and ultimately to verify that the work generated by the software development teams meets the stakeholders’ requirements.
The candidate will serve as a Scrum team Product Owner and be responsible for following established software engineering processes and methodologies, including Agile and SDLC, to successfully move solutions through the development lifecycle.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Translate business needs into requirements utilizing a structured process for gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change.
Clearly articulate and document business requirements via user stories and functional specifications.
Generate use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are captured.
Develop detailed documentation, such as gap analyses, business process flow charts, decision tables, features, and business requirements documents to aid in the development and refinement of new analytical tools and processes.
Quickly develop a detailed understanding of the data, processes, and systems utilized by the business area.
Serve as frontline support in troubleshooting process and systems issues and provide ongoing operational support, as needed.
Work to elicit detailed requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business sponsors.
Maintain project requirements and scope.
Support project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.
Provide input and support during implementation phase, to include carrying out software user testing, composing standard operating procedures (SOPs), and/or conducting employee training.
Maintain documentation of changes and improved procedures.
Support various functional applications.
Review product design documentation to ensure that requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable.
Understand application configuration and clearly articulate how changes are made.
Monitor performance after implementation of changes to prevent recurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation.
Research best practices, end-user needs, and present options and strategy for implementing changes.
Evaluate and understand current processes and workflows.
Proactively provide process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.
Proactively resolve customer satisfaction issues.
Work with outside vendors to deliver solutions.
Provide leadership assistance to other analysts by modeling best-practices and approaches and serving as a mentor and coach to more junior colleagues.
Apply strong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to operate in a cross-cultural and complex matrixed environment to build consensus across functions.
Ability to influence systems and business outcomes across immediate project teams, key stakeholders in IT, IT management, and limited stakeholders in business groups outside of IT.
Ability to be adaptable, open to change, and able to work in ambiguous situations, and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.
Capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.
Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
Maintain regular and reliable attendance.
Ability to act with an inclusion mindset and model these behaviors for the organization.
Ability to work designated schedule.
Ability to work nights and/or weekends, as needed.
Ability to work on a mobile devise, tablet, or in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 90% of a typical working day.
Ability and means to travel between local Exact Sciences locations.
Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in field as outlined in the essential duties; or High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) and 4 years of relevant experience as outlined in the essential duties in lieu of Bachelor’s Degree.
5+ years of relevant professional experience as outlined in the essential duties.
Proficient in Microsoft Office programs.
Demonstrated ability to perform the essential duties of the position with or without accommodation.
Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of experience operating under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.
Experience working as a business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development projects.
Experience working on Agile development teams.
Experience working in histology or molecular biology laboratories.
Experience working in the areas of order management, customer service systems, physician/patient portals, and/or patient reports.
Experience with any of the following data integration technologies: Middleware (ex: Mulesoft), APIs, or HL7.
Industry experience within biotechnology, life sciences, or healthcare.
EEO Disclosure:

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program are available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

description:
Job Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Requisition ID: 166361BR
When you’re a part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
What will you do?

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, LSG Global Operations- at Thermo Fisher Scientific is a multidimensional and dynamic position covering data, process, and technology within the Business Intelligence team that support all LSG Operational divisions and functions. This role will actively participate in division/group data integration projects covering Enterprise Data Platform, Data Lake, Data Warehouse and Data Science programs. In addition, this candidate will lend their expertise by engaging in various initiatives that drive to improve the customer experience. The candidate ensures data related standardization and harmonization of Operational Key Performance Indicators, communicates functional data requirements and reporting processes are in place to address complex and dynamic business needs. The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate leadership abilities in communication and presentation to executive leadership and colleagues, ability to influence without direct report responsibilities.
Roles & Responsibilities
Leads and administers the preparation of executive-level reports based on cross team collaboration of data analysis (recurring and adhoc)
Deliver on reporting and analytical requests for various ‘metrics that matter’ for a given function, division or team
Utilize strong analytical skills to proactively interrogate data, highlight trends and actionable insights, and partner with stakeholders in identifying Root Cause and Corrective Measure
Gather reporting business requirements, translate into functional data requirements and creatively deliver dashboard visualizations to effectively and simply represent performance and root cause for a given metric (‘data story teller’)
Proactively leverage the Operations network to understand, analyze and/or identify leading and lagging indicators for a given metric.
Build partnerships with key stakeholders and provide front line support for business intelligence reporting and analytics requests from various Operations divisions/groups
Lead and facilitate large cross functional operational mechanisms with Senior leadership.
Business intelligence partner to functional leadership, leading metrics review
Be a liaison to business or business IT group, for BI enhancement requests, providing additional functional requirements and testing support of new or updated Operations reports.
Leverage Ops BI Intake Process to prioritize projects, effectively and proactively communicating progress with business requesters.
Develops and documents standard work processes, always looking for productivity improvements.
Partner and collaborate with BI team members to deliver innovative Business Intelligence tools and solutions
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.
5-8 years of related business experience. Excellent working knowledge of key cross functional Operations business process, with 3 to 4 years practical Operations, Finance and or data management experience.
Strong data analysis skills required. Hands on experience managing data, it’s analysis, standardization, data clean up and consolidation.
Expertise in Microsoft O365 tools
Expertise in visualization tools i.e. PowerBI, Tableau, DOMO
Fluent in Data Warehouse management structures and external data skills.
Project management experience
Strong leadership, mentorship, communication and presentation skills
Competencies
Management, manipulation and analysis of large data sets from various source systems
Ability to assess, balance and articulate business data needs vs. any system constraints and identify innovative solutions as workarounds
Strong analytical skills to understand and determine key drivers of performance.
Able to articulate information, findings and complex data solutions concisely and with clarity at senior management level
Excellent oral and written communication skills, and ability to provide strategic direction to both technical and business organizations
Strong project management skills to balance multiple projects and prioritize effectively.
Ability to constructively negotiate discussions to ensure Global Ops KPI definitions and calculations are maintained.
Understanding of transactional data & flows across systems, data mapping and hierarchy concepts, and management reporting
Exposure/experience with IT infrastructure, IT application technologies, frameworks and data management background, preferred
Independent worker and as a member of a cross-functional team

positionName: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst - Sales, Lead to Cash
description:
LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform. We believe connected data has the power to change the world. Our platform powers insights and experiences centered around the needs of real people, and in ways that keep the Internet open for all. LiveRampers thrive on building together with curiosity and humility—and have a good bit of fun along the way. We're always looking for smart, kind, and creative people to grow our team and impact.

Mission: LiveRamp makes it safe and easy for businesses to use data effectively.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you own and drive the end-to-end Lead to Cash business processes and support the related technology solutions. As a Business Analyst you exhibit experience and knowledge in implementation and adoption of Salesforce.com Sales Cloud from lead to cash operations/functions. Act as a knowledgeable liaison between business stakeholders, technical teams and testing teams. As a Business Analyst you discover current state pain points and uncover gaps and come up with scalable systems and business process solutions. You will participate in design sessions with the technical team of architects, application administrators and developers and be responsible for documenting solution options with detailed supporting materials such as business process diagrams, wireframes and other context diagrams.

You Will

Collaborate and work with cross functional teams to enhance CRM ( lead generation to customer retention) and back-office enterprise application support functions ( such as billing and invoice generation).
Organize and drive business process re-engineering initiatives, conduct discovery discussions/ sessions / workshops, which includes the facilitation and solution presentations.
Build/Configure and demonstrate prototypes in Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ (SteelBrick) on functionalities like pricing, discounting , product bundling, approval processes and closed loop reporting needs of various stakeholders
Perform business process modelling, data flow , user experience modeling, and basic technical architecture diagramming for the entire customer journey through various software systems.
Identify and create an inventory of customer process pain points and gaps in industry best practices in each of the functional areas
Create and groom all of the requirements for each stakeholder groups such as sales, finance, billing etc for current and future sprints and understand development strategies
Perform rapid analysis and decomposition of complex business information into functional process components or specifications.
Interpret technical and business strategy and enterprise application roadmaps.
Participate and guide customers through user acceptance test planning and execution.
An excellent understanding of Salesforce.com's capabilities and limitations. Ability to clearly communicate those to customers as a trusted technology partner.
Ability to work with and leverage multiple implementation team types (User experience, Change Management, PMO, Developers and Contractors).

Your Team

You will be part of the high energy, can do and customer focused Business Technology team in an individual contributor role to partner and help transform lead to cash business processes. As a Business Analyst you strive to understand various internal customers ( Sales , Marketing , DealDesk , Billing and Legal Operations team) current state business processes and technology solutions in the CRM and CPQ space and support in implementation of best practices. You will exhibit experience and knowledge in Sales cloud implementation of Salesforce.com and act as a knowledgeable liaison between business stakeholders, SMEs , technical and testing teams . You will participate in design sessions with the technical team of architects, administrators and developers and be responsible for documenting solution options with detailed supporting materials such as business process diagrams, wireframes and other context diagrams.

About You

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education.
5+ years' experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Consultant for a midsized SAS (software as service) company/organization and/ or direct consulting expertise leading business transformation projects.
Excellent understanding of Sales Marketing , DealDesk , Billing and Legal processes.
 Experience with Salesforce.com CPQ configuration and familiarity with Salesforce.com custom development from customer's End to End processes perspective.
 Strong presentation and communication skills.
 Proven experience with gap analysis, benchmarking, trending, and root causes
 Experience in several mid-to large sized Salesforce implementations comprised of the following:
 In-Depth demonstrated knowledge of SFDC Sales cloud
 SFDC Communities ,3rd Party App Integration (AppExchange)
 CPQ (SteelBrick) and salesforce lightning experience preferred
 Data Migration, Data Cleansing, Data integrity and enforcement expertise
 Bonus/ Nice to have knowledge and experience in one or more of the
WorkDay
CSM tool ( GainSight)
CLM tool ( IronClad)
Account planning strategies ( DemandFarm)
Other Sales tools

Benefits:

People: Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do
Fun: We host in-person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues
Work/Life Harmony: Flexible paid time off, options for working from home, and paid parental leave
Whole Health Package: Medical, dental, vision, and disability insurance. Plus mental health support (via Talkspace) and a fitness reimbursement up to $100 per month
Savings: Our 401K matching plan—1:1 match up to 6% of salary—helps you plan ahead (U.S. LiveRampers)
RampRemote: A comprehensive office equipment and ergonomics program—we help you set up your home office (Home-based LiveRampers)
Location: work in the heart of San Francisco or Phoenix

More about us:

LiveRamp's mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles—one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents. Click here to learn more about Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DIB) at LiveRamp.

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
California residents: Please see our California Personnel Privacy Policy for more information regarding how we collect, use, and disclose the personal information you provide during the job application process.

To all recruitment agencies: LiveRamp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

positionName: Senior Analyst, qPCR Strategy & Marketing Analytics
description:
Location: US - South San Francisco, CA and /or Carlsbad, CA
Location/Division Specific Information
Our Genetic Sciences Division (GSD) is at the forefront of innovation for genetic analysis research and clinical applications. Our teams are developing platform and content solutions that help bring criminals to justice, accelerate disease research, and keep the worlds food supply safe. We also develop advanced methods for testing and detection of viruses, helping to prevent global outbreaks.
qPCR is one of the most impactful and fastest growing businesses within Genomics Sciences Division) and as a member of our team you can play a critical role in helping fulfill our mission. As part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
How will you make an impact?
Senior Analyst, Strategy & Marketing Analytics supports qPCR annual strategic planning initiative, provides market and competitive insights to enable qPCR to better serve our customers and drive the overall growth strategy and performance for qPCR. This role will collaborate with qPCR Finance, Product Management team as well as Life Sciences Data and Marketing Analytics team. This is a highly visible position within the division and requires strong expertise working with cross functional teams to meet their needs in terms of market and customer data, analysis and recommendations. The role requires strong expertise in monitoring external factors, including market forces, macro/microeconomic factors, and competitive implications as well as the growth forecasting.
What will you do?
Strategic Planning Review:
Maintain the bottom-up and top-down market sizing analysis across qPCR business including research, applied and clinical markets to estimate the market potential and qPCR share
Analyze current and future qPCR market trends to identify opportunities to transform the marketplace and accelerate qPCR growth
Synthesize information on market conditions into key actions and input to day to day business as well as formal business reviews
qPCR Competitive and Market Landscape:
Monitor market and competition across qPCR instruments and consumables
Support New Product Introductions (NPI) and business cases by providing market sizing and business opportunity working with Product Management and Finance teams
Work with external consultants / vendors for certain projects and manage the project to get the right outcome from the defined scope
Marketing Analytics
Define most important KPIs to track and measure across different campaigns and initiatives
Work with IT team to automate the dashboard
Provide monthly / quarterly Marketing reporting around key metrics
Suggest actions for improvement based on insights from data
Forecast and develop the right strategies, campaigns, and tests to run
BS/BA in a life-science and/or business discipline preferred but not required
Advanced degree in Business (MBA) preferred
3+ years working in the life science tools, pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device industries in a business support role
5+ years’ experience within a business, consulting firm, or finance
Experience working with, and communicating to, senior level executives
Experience working within cross functional teams and delivering compelling presentations
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities/Requirements
Bachelor Degree
Knowledge of the Life Science Tools industry; key players, market dynamics and customer segmentation preferable within genomics space
MBA-level financial acumen
Ability to synthesize large amounts of data into concise and actionable take-aways
Ability to excel in a highly-matrixed environment
Deep knowledge of MS Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint, with a track record of creating compelling presentations
Excellent analytical, and planning skills with the ability to learn quickly
Sound strategic thinking and analytical mindset
Exceptional communication skills whether it is to be able to articulate a complex strategy and to translate it into impactful presentations, or to communicate effectively with a global and diverse team
Ability to be comfortable with ambiguity and stepping outside of his/her comfort zone and show initiative
Willingness to travel up to 20% of the time, both domestic and international

Experience managing Business Intelligence Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and/or Business Analysts
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related business/analytical disciplines
5+ years of industry experience in Business Intelligence, Data Science, Data Engineering, Software Development, or related field with a track record of producing actionable business insights from large datasets
Hands-on experience with SQL and data visualization tools (e.g. QuickSight, Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent communication skills to summarize insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication
Ability to navigate ambiguity to develop and champion new ideas and creative solutions
Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers

eero is looking for a Business Intelligence Manager to build a new team from the ground up. BI will help eero unlock the value latent in its data by providing visibility into our operations, driving better business decisions, and empowering stakeholders to understand their business and customers in new ways. The team will be multidisciplinary across data engineering and analytics, and will work across a diverse set of teams, from manufacturing, to product, to finance, and more.

eero was the first product to bring a whole-home WiFi experience using mesh technology to consumers. Since then, we have continued to deliver more value to our customers through improvements to performance, reliability, and price. We are now looking to lead the way in making the connected home experience even better.

Job responsibilities

As the first hire and manager of the BI team, you will:

Hire and develop a team of Data Engineers, BI Engineers, and Analysts
Shape and execute a technical vision for data warehousing and data marts
Standardize metrics and reporting across the organization
Engage with stakeholders to build and prioritize a roadmap
Help teams identify their key metrics and how to affect them based on their data

Success in this role will require technical breadth and strong communication and judgement skills. You will need to understand both the business side, and data engineering side of BI so that you can be an effective leader of the team.
