positionName: Senior Specialist, Pricing and Data Analytics Operations
description:
Senior Specialist, Pricing and Data Analytics Operations – San Francisco, California
Does your expertise lie in operational analytics? Are you excited about leveraging data-driven insights to drive revenue and customer acquisition?
Do you want to work on a brand-new team with high visibility? Then join Western Union as a Senior Specialist, Pricing and Data Analytics Operations.
Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful
We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 10,000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.
Better is enabled by trust and respect
We are seeking a Senior Specialist, Pricing and Data Analytics Operations, based in San Francisco, California. This role will sit in the Global Pricing team and report to the Pricing Product & Operations Lead. In this role, you will be responsible for the management of pricing programs, KPI tracking, and value assurance. You will partner with other members of the pricing team and regional Go-To-Market partners to deliver results at scale.
You will coordinate with business verticals to build and execute dynamic pricing strategies. Setup and manage pricing experiments in A/B testing tools. Create monitoring tools/processes to ensure prices are implemented as intended. Design & manage price change performance reporting tools and processes. Design & manage the sourcing of competitive price positioning data and create visualizations to drive business insights. Partner with Pricing’s Quantitative Engineers to design and operationalize analytical data sets for use by the rest of the Pricing team. Partner with WU’s Product and Platform teams to build and operate the Pricing AI/ML model pipeline. Partner with WU’s Product and Platform teams to develop infrastructure and pricing tools that increase agility and operational efficiency. Support design of the future state of pricing tools, data, and processes. Actively contribute n team huddles and strategy sessions. Champion company purpose and values, as well as policies/procedures
You have experience with systems operations, especially A/B testing tools such as Optimizely, Evergage, or Braze. Proficient in both traditional data warehousing and big data technologies such as SQL, Python, Snowflake, Hadoop, and Sagemaker. Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and ThoughtSpot. Ability to redesign business processes for efficiency through the use of tools and data. Exposure to predictive and prescriptive analytics and data science principles. Experience working closely with Data Scientists. Experience in AWS or other major cloud technology, especially operationalizing models in an AI/ML environment. Collaborative personality with the ability to build relationships both within the team and across the organization to drive change. Brings a continuous improvement mindset. Strong sense of accountability for quality and delivery of end results. Able to work in a fast-paced environment and actively prioritize work against team and company objectives. Educational background in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related discipline. 3-5 years of professional experience, ideally with at least 1 year in pricing. Experience in financial services is a plus. Experience in pricing is a plus. University degree, plus 3+ years related experience. (MBA preferred) Proficient in SQL/SAS.
Join us, and let’s move money for better
Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.

We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.

We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran (U.S.) status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws.
Annual base salary gross: $ 83,909 - $143,195.00. The base salary range represents the anticipated low and high end of the Western Union salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and proficiency for the role. The base salary is one component of Western Union’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include short term incentives, health insurance (several options to choose from), accident and life insurance, access to the best in class learning and development platforms, to name just a few! To view more details of our benefits, visit us here: https://2020-2021.mywubenefits.com In addition to the annual salary, this role is also eligible to receive an annual bonus.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce is working with a San Francisco, CA client that is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to join their team remotely for a 6 month contract with likely extensions. In addition to have worked on Salesforce related roles as a Business Analyst it is required that you have Salesforce Administration experience.

Responsibilities of the Salesforce Business Analyst:

Minimum 1-2 years of experience working in Agile/Scrum development environment using Sprints to deliver minimum viable products (MVP)

Excellent analytical skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment are essential, as are outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Salesforce Business Analyst will align with global, division and business unit strategies and business requirements
Understanding of business data management and modelling
Leadership, planning, and execution skills

positionName: Oracle Security Technical Business Analyst Specialist
description:
Are you interested in a dynamic career with Kaiser Permanente? We are looking for an Oracle Security Technical Business Analyst who specializes in building custom job roles across the HCM application covering Core HR, Benefits, Time & Labor , Absence Management, Talent & Performance, Performance Management, Workforce Compensation, Payroll, IT and Business Intelligence (BI) functional areas. An ideal candidate would be conversant with controlling access via applying Structures, Page Composures, El Expressions and Design Studio Changes. We are looking for someone who is comfortable in building data roles, security profiles and using security framework and setting up auto provision rules. Other key responsibilities include, and not limited to; ensuring security configuration is aligned with SOX and compliance controls, building Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence (OTBI) reports specific to security, understanding requirements to set up system accounts to support environment and integration testing, create and execute functional role test cases/defect management, and support internal and external audit requests.






Provides technical expertise to deliver new solutions as well as on-going product maintenance. Works with HR, IT, and vendors to contribute to the management and performance of the application, including development and production support. Responsible for identifying and documenting business processes through interviewing clients and reviewing and analyzing existing systems and processes. Articulates interrelationships and recasts business flow into system specifications. Conducts gap analyses to document discrepancies between business requirements and system capabilities. May develop project plans and ensure plan adherence. As system development progresses, may have input into reporting requirements/report development, user interfaces, and coordinates or conducts UAT and the final evaluation of the system solution. Supports the agile methodology and works with SCRUM teams as needed to ensure user stories are delivered.
Essential Responsibilities:
Project Planning and Execution: Supports and provides technical expertise on programs and projects as assigned. Supports project teams through detailed design, product support, analysis, and reporting. Participates in project management process, including participating in project meetings. May document issues, action items, user requirements, or deliverables from project meetings. Performs a variety of project related activities, including analysis or preparation of documentation and presentations. Plans and manages initiatives, proposals, or projects, including identifying project resource needs and roles. Accomplishes all work within established methodologies and standards. Supports the agile methodology and participates in SCRUM teams as needed.

Requirements Definition and Analysis: Collects and researches specific client requirements for projects, identifies requirements, gathers workflow data and basic system and reporting specifications, in collaboration with IT, Portfolio Managers, and functional Business analysts. Works closely with partners to ensure requirements are translated into test plans and scripts to support project needs. Helps capture and maintain use cases, user stories, test plans, and test scripts. Develops, implements, and supports common business processes and tools. Recommends basic alternatives to address problems. Assesses and manages risks to minimize impact to the overall operations and/or project. Provides functional direction in a particular area of the operation or project.


Business User/Owner Application Support: Understands product features and roadmap. Provides 2nd and 3rd tier application support for assigned application(s). Monitors production batch and ad hoc jobs as required to ensure proper functioning and completion of business operations. Researches and resolves technical and functional issues according to defined prioritization/severity scheme, in collaboration with IT and the vendors as needed. Resolves medium-high complexity system issues. Configures application for medium-high complexity business requirements. Modifies, and reviews solutions, tools, and systems. Helps maintain system configuration, e.g., creation of new codes and changes to existing codes. Conducts data load and conversation activities. Supports releases and system upgrades. Coordinates with vendors for enhancements. Influences client and gains commitment to changes required.


Solutioning: Partner with the Portfolio team and assist with identifying potential solutions for client's business needs/problems. Provides technical expertise on cross-functional task forces as assigned and helps identify and document technical requirements, workflow, information sources and system specifications.


Business and Process Improvement: Identifies opportunities for business or process improvement; makes associated recommendations as appropriate.


Account Management: Manages relationships with assigned customers/internal clients. As a change agent, works to drive culture change, client communications, and related work regarding system changes, implementations, and related business process impacts.





Basic Qualifications:
Experience
Minimum eight (8) years directly related professional experience, to include three (3) years in a consultative role required.
Education
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering/Operations Research, or related field, OR four (4) years of directly related experience required.
High school diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.
License, Certification, Registration
N/A
Additional Requirements:
Ability to contribute to the development of concepts, techniques, and standards in general business analysis, as well as HR principles and practices.
Advanced knowledge of information technology and applications.
Human resources knowledge and experience.
Expert ability in analysizing and documenting processes, methods, solutions, etc.
Strong interpretive skills to translate business processes and requirements into system specifications.
Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Twelve (12) years directly related professional experience, to include four (4) years in a consultative role preferred.

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
If you would like to contact SWCA regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the online application process due to a disability, please email accommodations@swca.com or call 1-480-581-5378. This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

positionName: Senior Manager/Associate Director, Commercial Insights and Analytics – Market Access
description:
Myovant Sciences aspires to be the leading healthcare company focused on innovative treatments for women's health and prostate cancer designed to improve the lives of millions. We are on a mission to develop and deliver empowering medicines for women's health and prostate cancer through purpose-driven science and transformative advocacy. We are looking for passionate and hard-working individuals who share our excitement for this mission.

We are currently seeking a qualified, highly motivated, experienced individual for the position of Senior Manager/Associate Director, Commercial Insights and Analytics – Market Access. The position reports to Senior Director, Commercial Insights and Analytics. The location of the position is in Brisbane, CA.

Summary Description

The Senior Manager/Associate Director, Commercial Insights and Analytics – Market Access will have primary responsibility for conducting business analysis to inform the commercial strategy, including primary research and secondary data analytics related to payers, pricing, contracting, and key segments to inform commercial strategy and forecasting. The role coordinates with the Market Access team and brand teams to generate key insights and recommendations that drive strategy and execution for prostate and women's health indications.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Secondary Data Analytics (50%)

Responsible for analysis of payer data including payer targeting and coverage tracking
Patient support program analytics
Regularly communicate with Senior Executives and strategic partners to report analytical findings and key performance metrics
Provide thought leadership and insights to Market Access and Brand leadership teams, providing expert opinions on the impact of market and competitor events as risks and opportunities to their near and long-range planning
Identify potential opportunities through data and business analytics and present findings to the Market Access team
Create sustainable tools and capabilities to enable business analytics and insights for the Market Access team.

Market Research (50%)

Develop market research plan to inform business strategy, including qualitative, quantitative research and competitive intelligence projects to drive high quality insights and recommendations to inform strategy.
Work with Market Access team leads and other key stakeholders to identify knowledge gaps and market research needs.
Develop market research plans and prioritize market research studies based on budget and business needs.
Communicate and align key internal stakeholders around market research objectives and outputs
Select appropriate research methodology to address business objective
Develop and present final reports and actionable recommendations to key stakeholders
Lead market research projects, including vendor selection, design, execution and interpretation of market research results to deliver insights.
Manage vendor partnerships including negotiating costs, on-boarding, ensuring accountability, and timely project execution.
Monitor the market environment and events to provide recommendations on potential research needs.
Support forecasting by providing subject matter expertise in refining forecast assumptions
Participate in strategic planning including situation analysis, market access plans, brand plans, market assessments to present insights and to inform market research and analytics needs.

Core Competencies, Knowledge, and Skill Requirements

Experience in Market Access secondary analytics and market research
High analytical capability with history of effectively directing and leveraging market research and developing and tracking performance metrics and market insights
Vendor and budget management
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks/assignments and meeting short deadlines
Interest in exploring and developing new approaches, processes and methodologies
Ability to recognize project issues/concerns and make recommendations to resolve
Highly-skilled in influencing and effectively partnering with cross-functional teams
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, project management, and confident executive presence
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

REQUIREMENTS

Education

Bachelor of Art or Science in Health Sciences or related discipline/Business Administration

Experience

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience for Senior Manager level or minimum of 8-10 years of experience for Associate Director level in the pharmaceutical industry, with relevant experience in data analysis, decision support, product level forecasting and market research
Previous experience working with Market Access in an analytics role preferred
Pharmaceutical/Biotech experience strongly preferred

Travel

Limited travel up to 20%

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

If you require any accommodations, please email careers@myovant.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The Phillips Academy
Our mission at The Phillips Academy is to provide a comprehensive, positive, educational program for youth with complex behavioral, social, emotional and educational needs.
Through collaboration with our families and the referring school districts, The Phillips Academy strives to enhance the quality of students’ lives and enable them to reach their full potential in society. A positive attitude toward learning, a sense of self-competence, and essential academic and social-emotional skills are developed through personalized education plans. We are committed to preparing students for successful transitions to public school programs, to post-secondary educational institutions and to vocational training programs, upon completion of our program.
We are looking for educators and leaders who want to join a small diverse team dedicated to bringing in inclusion, belonging, and equity into the most marginalized population of our education system. The Phillips Academy was opened in 1971 by Dr. Laura Phillips, a behavioral psychologist, as an advocate for those who are underserved in our educational system.
Position Summary:
We are looking for a compassionate and exceptional leader in behavior analysis and intervention implementation to join our Behavior Support team. You’ll work collaboratively along the side of our special educators, mental health providers and behavior support team to drive the success of our students' achievement in their academics, and social emotional learning and their growth in the Individual Education Plans. You will use data to drive behavior plans. Support staff creating and implementing student individualized behavior plans by regularly assessing student progress through a behavior system of data, to ensure that each child’s personalized learning plan addresses their unique needs and goals for growth. You'll equitably support the development of each child through restorative practices and social-emotional learning strategies. You will build meaningful relationships with families because you believe they are partners, and play a critical role in student success.
What We Look For
We are looking for individuals dedicated and committed not only to their educational practice but also to the work around social awareness that impacts the educational institution.
All Students Can Learn. if provided with the right instructional strategies, the right support, and the necessary motivation.
Relationships Foster Learning. Growth is also seen as a direct outcome of the positive relationships students develop with staff and peers.
Students Have a Voice. Students are viewed as necessary and active participants in their educational plans, are taught self-management skills, and are encouraged to express their concerns openly, appropriately and effectively.
A Team Approach. A team approach including family participation is cultivated to develop the most comprehensive and effective plans.
Process and Outcome–Based Program. The implementation of instructional strategies and behavioral interventions is evaluated for fidelity and effectiveness on an ongoing basis. Teaching strategies and plans are modified as needed.
Core Values
A collective through collaborating in servicing our community
Reflective and actively engaged in receiving and giving feedback
Problem solve with inquiry, empathy and kindness
Goal and Action Oriented
Culture of belonging, affirmation, and validation across difference
Responsibilities
Function in a supervisory capacity and provide oversight to all areas of programming including the training of direct support professionals, person centered strategies consultants (if applicable) and DSP trainers.
Assist in the development, facilitation, and follow-up training in Applied Behavior Analysis, using both discrete trial training and natural environment training models of teaching.
Facilitate and assist in the development and identification of resources and support information for clients and their families
Provide model teaching and other direct instructional support including, but not limited to, practicum supervision/teaching, class instruction and in-service instruction to other support professionals.
Assist in the development and implementation of assessment tools, to conduct functional assessments and analyses when appropriate, and to develop appropriate behavior strategies to teach appropriate behavior and reduce maladaptive behaviors.
 Provide ongoing support and training to direct support professionals, ABA implementers, and other individuals in support roles for families.
Ongoing training and supervision of paraprofessional staff in implementation of ABA principles and methodology and behavior reduction strategies.
Create an ongoing data collection system to establish baseline and programmatic efficacy for all consumers, and to analyze data on a frequent and ongoing basis to guide programming.
 Develop behavior plans/treatment plans for all consumers with a focus on teaching and other antecedent strategies for reducing problematic behavior(s).
Meet as needed with supervised staff to discuss ongoing consumer issues and to provide support when necessary.
Review and sign off on behavior plan/treatment plan training for all field staff and provide field supervision when necessary.
 Provide consultation services and to maintain ongoing communication with all constituents (other supports, parents, community, and community agencies).
 Keep current with the literature, new research findings and resources. In addition, continuing education courses to maintain BCBA certification are necessary (32 credits every 2 years).
Maintain all data, paperwork, and communication between personal care staff and families, and to provide ongoing feedback to government related agencies that contract with such families.
Lead, support and train staff on Restorative practices and approaches such as RJ projects and conversations.
Experience:
Successful completion of internship and/or formal training in the analysis of behavior and instructional strategies training related to working with clients who have pervasive developmental disorders and related disorders, their parents, and other agencies working with clients.
Preferred Mental health background
Skills:
Comfort with technology: basic skills in navigating computer hardware and software
Organizational skills: ability to manage multiple work streams simultaneously
Analytical and problem solving ability:
Use data to drive instructional and behavioral results
Ability to deeply understand each student’s needs and help them achieve their goals
Communicates effectively with others: shares ideas directly and respectfully & advocates for needs.
Education:
Master’s degree in Special Education or related human services field;
Completion of BCBA internship/ formal training
Preferred passed the Board Exams.
Salary scales are based on years of experience and expertise. Scales are competitive with other charter school organizations and local districts.
The Phillips Academy provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

description:
Gilead Sciences is continuing to hire for all open roles. Our interview process may be conducted virtually and some roles will be asked to temporarily work from home. Over the coming weeks and months, we will be implementing a phased approach to bringing employees back to site to ensure the health and safety of our teams.


For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.
Job Description
R&D and PDM Data & Analytics – Business Engagement and Solution Delivery Leader
Gilead Sciences, Inc. is a research-based biopharmaceutical company founded in 1987. Together we deliver life-saving therapies to patients in need. With the commitment and drive you bring to the workplace every day, you will be part of a team that is changing the world and helping millions of people live healthier, more fulfilling lives. Our worldwide staff is a close community where you can see the tangible results of your contributions, where every individual matters, and everyone has a chance to enhance their skills through ongoing development. Our scientific focus has resulted in marketed products that are benefiting hundreds of thousands of people, a pipeline of late-stage drug candidates, and unmatched patient access programs to ensure medications are available to those who could otherwise not afford them. By joining Gilead, you will further our mission to address unmet medical needs and improve life by advancing the care of patients with life-threatening diseases.
Specific Responsibilities & Skills
The Sr. Director of Enterprise Data & Analytic Ent. D&A): R&D & PDM function will report directly to the Head of Enterprise Data & Analytics and is responsible for overseeing functions including:
Business Partnership: Serve as Enterprise D&A counterpart to Research, Development, Medical Affairs, and Pharmaceutical Development & Manufacturing business organizations and support their analytics mission to accelerate “research to release” processes for all Gilead therapies and meet patient needs. Understand the value drivers of the business and ensure Enterprise Ent. D&A solutions are scalable and can expand to support new therapeutic areas while considering innovation and cost to serve.
Domain Expertise: Partner with senior leadership across business to create a technology strategy that supports the Research area to enable discovery and pre-clinical development of small molecule and biologics drugs, and their clinical development to address the unmet medical need. This includes the External Innovation approach of enabling successful, strategic partnerships, to accelerate the discovery of transformational medicines. Provide insight that will allow Development and Medical Affairs to discover, develop and commercialize therapeutics that advance patient care and help maximize patient benefit. Have an understanding of the practical application of analytical systems to manage regulatory affairs, quality, analytical operations, clinical and commercial manufacturing activities throughout the product lifecycle for small molecule and biologic products in all therapeutic areas including Supply Chain and Serialization controls within PDM function.
Technology Standardization and Strategy: Support analytical platform decisions, implement AI/ML and automation, improve user satisfaction and drive for operational efficiencies to obtain measured business value. Support strategies to invest in cloud-first business architecture. Deliver scalable and flexible solutions to meet unanticipated business demand. Continuously invest in innovation to incubate new opportunities requested by business partners in support of the Strategic Technology Council investment and reduce the cost to serve through careful consideration of technology investments.
Global Vision: Able to synthesize customer analytical needs and challenges presented by multiple competing capabilities that include Research, Clinical Drug Development, Medical Affairs, multiple commercial manufacturing sites/contractor manufacturers, supply chain activities (Clinical and Commercial), Quality/Regulatory Assurance, and product serialization processes.
Ent. D&A as a Business Value Driver : Supports the ongoing development, coordination, and execution of the integrated Ent. D&A strategy including labor, investment choices, organizational priorities, and scorecards and dashboards to support and define business value.
Essential Duties and Job Functions
General responsibilities for this position will include (but are not limited to) the following:
Collaborate with business partners to identify future analytical business needs and prioritize resources/effort on evolving analytical capabilities from “Research to Release” for all current and future Gilead therapies
Manage and lead an international team through thoughtful performance management and individualized career development plans based on individual needs and corporate strateg
Implement Ent. D&A: R&D & PDM analytical strategy to support business process improvements and deliver tangible efficiencies
Enhance business value through collaborative identification of business needs
Serve as a primary point of engagement with Business Partners on requirements definitions for all Ent. D&A.
Participate in analytical business strategy and capabilities as an intake for PMO & Technology Roadmap.
Develop Business Cases for Ideation and Project Prioritization
Ideate, prioritize, and deliver on analytical portfolio investments to ensure Business Value/Outcomes are realized based on prioritized business needs
Ensure governance and executive sponsorship across business units
Ensure necessary business processes are documented and business ownership is available for analytical projects and ongoing compliance activities
Collaborate and define Ent. D&A domain architecture and partner with the business to establish analytics strategy
Optimize Ent. D&A organizational focus on core capabilities and leverage partners to provide high-value services
Embed and measure user experience and value realization in every stage of analytical investment decisions, apart from creating insights through high-quality customer experience data
Transition function to a data-driven organization
Ensure Gilead and Ent. D&A organization(s) are compliant at every juncture
Required Education & Experience
Bachelor's in Computer Sciences, Data Science or Business administration
12 or more years in IT, Data & Analytics, and business/industry
A minimum of 5-7 years of leadership responsibilities
Expert experience in relevant analytical platforms (Research, Development, Regulatory Compliance, Medical Affairs, Quality, Regulatory Affairs, Analytical Operations, Clinical and Commercial manufacturing)
Experience in business/industry (beyond IT), managing cross-functional teams or projects, and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders
Good understanding of GxP activities
Preferred Skills/Education
Master's degree in business administration or Computer Science
15 or more years of experience in IT, Data & Analytics, and business/industry
Knowledge and Skills
Relationship builder with strong leadership capability, executing as appropriate in the areas of responsibility
Expertise in budget planning, financial management, and workforce management
Broad knowledge of current and emerging analytical technologies, technology directions, and strategic application to business needs including the ability to differentiate between a relevant trend and hype
Ability to improve operational efficiency, service delivery, and information management across the Ent. D&A organization
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technology solutions in business terms, establish rapport and persuade others

positionName: Senior Sales Strategy Manager (Senior Manager I, Business Analysis and Insights, eComm) - Walmart Connect
description:
Position Summary...
What you'll do...
At Walmart, we enable the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. As primary stewards of our brand promise, “Save Money. Live Better,” we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150M households who shop with us. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. We believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have Walmart’s sales data to prove it. Walmart Connect wins when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth; Walmart and our supplier partners win when your digital expertise helps sell more goods online and offline. Growth in our digital advertising business is key to Walmart’s overall growth strategy.
Walmart Connect (WMC) is looking for a Senior Sales Strategy Manager who will be not only a driver but an effective cross-functional collaborator as they team to a) Support and challenge media strategy through insightful media analyses in partnership with our Yield team, b) identify opportunities for improvement on existing in-market sales activities working with Revenue Operations, Yield, and Measurement Insights & Analytics, c) partner with Product, Product Marketing, and Business Operations on valuation, alpha/beta selection and timing, positioning. You will also be responsible for partnering with WMC’s Omni Solutions team on seasonal strategy as well as new integrated experiences.
This candidate will also be the primary WMC “face of Sales” with Walmart Marketing from a general communication and operational reporting perspective. The ideal candidate will be able to understand the qualitative as well as the quantitative aspects of developing a holistic GTM sales strategy. As the Senior Sales Strategy Manager, you will be able to articulate the needs of Sales from the marketer standpoint while balancing the dynamics of operating an ads business within the largest retailer. You’ll be able to lead cross-functional teams through conflict to a workable resolution.
The ideal candidate will have a strong baseline knowledge of how a digital media business operates so they have an understanding of the various interdependencies and hand-offs across the functional teams in order to create and implement large scale strategies across a 500+ organization.
Responsibilities:
Drive development of annual seasonal strategy with WMC Omni Solutions and Yield.
Lead development and execution any new integrated marketing and content offerings that are aligned with our overall GTM strategy and existing JBP strategy.
Manage the operational relationship with the Home Page Marketing team as the primary “face of Sales” to communicate necessary updates, reporting, etc. with the intent of building a strong relationship of partnership and transparency.
Determine the appropriate GTM strategy and operational integration of new Marketing content experiences or initiatives and Product alphas and betas.
Partner cross-functionally to develop necessary narratives around key sales initiatives such as our seasonal and annual joint business planning (JBP) strategy.
Own the operational relationship with the Walmart Home Page Marketing team partnering with Yield Ops to provide ongoing updates and reporting.
Frame and break down complex business problems into key components, design analysis to drive insights and answers to critical questions, and recommend practical solutions to get results
Collect & analyze data and information through quantitative and qualitative avenues to make decisions on critical strategic issue
Support management in strategic, operational planning and ensure decisions align overall WMC sales approach and goals
Qualifications:
Minimum 5 years’ experience in digital ads industry in sales operations, sales solutions, sales strategy, account management, monetization, or performance marketing.
Strong verbal and written communications – able to communicate effectively across varied audience base such as Product, Ad Ops, Marketing, and Leadership.
Analytically minded and able to use data driven insights along with qualitative inputs to develop a sales strategy that is aligned with WMC’s overall GTM narrative.
Expertise in Excel, Order Management System, Salesforce, SQL relational databases and BI tools like Tableau
Working knowledge of fundamentals of running a digital media business - trafficking, tracking and reporting processes, measurement, techniques and technologies
Excellent project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple, simultaneous solutions executed by support teams
Experience developing or overseeing quantitative analysis and delivering actionable insights
Self-starter mentality and entrepreneurial spirit with a strong drive for excellence and delivery of results
Some business insights or analysis

Sprout Mortgage's technology team is growing, and we are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, you'll work to develop custom built solutions for retail loan officer, wholesale, correspondent, and loan manufacturing systems inside a developing digital ecosystem for the mortgage industry. You must understand the needs of different user personas and be able to articulate these to various groups within the product team and business organization. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and help implement the deployment plan. You will be asked to wear many hats and be a front-line contributor in leading product development. You will be the voice of the business to the development team and answer any questions and provide clarification on requirements. If you do not know the answer, you will find out from the relevant party. We are looking for a Do-It-All Rockstar who is great at building relationships, someone who will go the extra mile, wants to help build market defining products, and grow to manage their own product(s) in the future.

Desired Skills & Experience

Required

3+ years of experience working as a business analyst, preferably with finance/mortgage knowledge.
Experience working with new product development, creation of various artifacts such as SRS, FS, Use Cases, Data Flows and Process Flows for specific features within a project release.
Ability to meet with various business/client partners to understand their needs and challenge.
Must be able to write clear and concise business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Capable of analyzing and documenting data transformations and logic that need to be built to support the exchange of information, both internal and external.
Competency in basic product smoke testing.
Experience working within standard Agile methodologies, including, but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban.
Lead process improvement with your business partners and identify bottlenecks.
Experience working with a distributed team.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or foreign equivalent required.

Preferred

Experience with EllieMae Encompass
Strong core Business Analysis skills in the areas of elicitation, requirements analysis, business process improvement, requirements modeling, gap analysis, functional decomposition and design, data modeling, rapid prototyping, and other techniques (Agile experience preferable).
Strong analytical skills with an understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Experience with JIRA or any other project management tool (bonus if you know Aha!).
Experience with Cloud Environments (i.e., AWS, Azure, and Google).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Learns quickly when facing new problems, enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and is willing to experiment and try anything to find solutions.
Ability to effectively manage and facilitate meetings.

positionName: Yield Operations Manager II, Business Analysis and Insights, eComm - Walmart Connect
description:
Position Summary...
What you'll do...
The Yield Operations Manager will manage day-to-day yield decisions, pricing, deals and discounts, evaluation of inventory volume, rollout of rate cards while partnering closely with Sales Ops, Sales, Ad Ops and the Analytics team in ensuring maximum budget fulfillment, creation and review of media plans and packages, and advising direct Sales on what we can fulfill.
The key focus areas for the Yield Operations Manager are:
Own inventory management including forecasting and monitoring inventory for Categories and Advertisers
Leverage campaign performance data to analyze and identify new ways to maximize ad revenue and provide actionable recommendations to Sales teams to hit goals
Lead Advertiser trends, performance, and action-oriented metric reviews with internal teams (revenue, impressions, clicks by Advertiser/campaigns).
Work with Sales and Sales Ops to identify potential areas of opportunities and risks with contracts and connect those with financial impact
Own the enforcement of policies and processes related to makegoods, pricing, and discounts
Work with Sales Ops and Sales to define the process in managing premium inventory bookings while working with Tools teams to build automated solutions
Work with the Analytics and Tools teams to build operational and revenue models that show the impact of the Yield Ops strategies
Provide input to Ad Ops on campaign pacing and optimization
Qualifications:
5+ years of progressive media analytics experience in a digital advertising environment
Excellent communicator, across multiple levels/functions with the ability to influence and drive action
Strong written, presentation and verbal communication with the ability to express complex topics clearly and easily
Strong working knowledge of Ad network/Ad exchange/DSP/SSP/Publisher preferred
Proven track record of partnering with Sales, Sales Ops, and Ad Ops to achieve yield optimization results
Excellent quantitative and qualitative problem-solving skills, experience with financial analysis, forecasting and modeling
Experience in developing monetization strategies, inventory optimization, and campaign management
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, startup like environment
Excellent time management skills with a focus on execution, ability to juggle multiple urgent requests and prioritize responsibilities
Familiarity with CRM and AdTech systems (Salesforce, DFP, Google Ads Manager, etc.)
About Walmart Connect
At Walmart, we enable the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. As primary stewards of our brand promise, "Save Money. Live Better," we work alongside some of the most talented people in the world to engage with the more than 150M households who shop with us. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team within the largest company in the world. We believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have Walmart's sales data to prove it.
Benefits & Perks:
Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.
Who We Are
Join Walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. www.careers.walmart.com
Minimum Qualifications...
Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field and 2 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area OR 4 years' experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area.
Preferred Qualifications...
Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.
Statistical Programming Language
Masters: Analytics, Masters: Business
Project Management - Project Management Professional - Certification, Six Sigma - Certification

Work independently with users to define business needs under direction of project managers.

Evaluates data gathered from multiple sources, reconciles differences, and ensures consistent data interpretation are met and result measurements are implemented.

Capable of managing multiple complex projects simultaneously.

Ability to write user stories, manage scrum calls, and prioritize backlog.

Collaborate with Product Owner and Developers to compose requirements.

Act as liaison between the customer and the project team.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Typically viewed as the Subject Matter Expert (SME).

positionName: Principal Business Development Manager, Data Analytics – AWS Marketplace
description:
STEM, or otherwise technical undergraduate degree
10+ years of partner experience at a Director level or above
5+ years working across the Data Analytics software, ISV and channels ecosystems.

Principal Business Development Manager, Big Data– AWS Marketplace

AWS Marketplace (AWS MP) is looking for a principal Business Development Manager within AWS Marketplace Data Analytics Category. In this position, you will work closely with teams across AWS to build relationships with existing, high-profile Data Analytics ISV partners, as well as emerging start-ups. You will be responsible for critical aspects of the AWS Marketplace business, influencing vendors' product strategy and delivering software in a new cloud model. You will identify short-term partner and product opportunities, while laying the groundwork for longer-term, strategic Data Analytics ISVs and products to be added to the Marketplace. In addition, you will be responsible for defining the primary use cases for why AWS customers use the Marketplace to deploy joint ISV & AWS Data Analytics category solutions.

AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog customers can use to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software, data, and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. To learn more about Marketplace, our categories and the services we support, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace

Responsibilities:

Define and execute the AWS Marketplace Data Analytics software and ISV selection strategy.
Identify and recruit ISVs into the AWS Marketplace Data Analytics category ecosystem which could include emerging startups and/or established technology vendors.
Work with existing Data Analytics ISV product, business development, channel and field organizations to define and execute joint go to market programs.
Execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).
Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint Data Analytics IVS + AWS value proposition.
Engage with Data Analytics ISV field organizations, channels and end customers to generate demand and revenue.
Understand the technical requirements of Data Analytics ISVs and serve as a conduit to AWS MP’s internal product management and engineering teams to inform and influence the direction of AWS products and features.
Prepare and present Data Analytics category and ISV business reviews to the AWS Executive Leadership team.
Lead, negotiate and complete complex contract negotiations and serve as a partner liaison to the legal group.

Position can be based out of Seattle, Bay Area, or New York.

Life/work balance

Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable us to scale faster than the business. There will be opportunities to work from home some days, as you will be traveling around 30% of the time with this role. Work hours are flexible and typically self-defined.

Mentorship and Career Growth

One of the keys to AWS’s success is its top-tier product management culture. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple AWS business lines that can help you accelerate your career and bring ideas to market. You will be working closely with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2, Redshift), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Working with a team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results is exciting. Partnering with others in the organization is key to our long term success and is what helps frame our inclusive culture.


MBA or Graduate degree
Knowledge of Cloud computing technology (ideally AWS) and software pricing models.
A combination of sales, business development, product management, channel management and product marketing experience.
Technical acumen and experience driving emerging/disruptive technologies like open source software, virtualization, and Software as a Service delivery models.
The ability to work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within a partner ecosystem.
Experience working within enterprise software development industry, and with the enterprise customer journey to the cloud.

***Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us
