At Volta we’re on a mission to accelerate the adoption of the electric vehicle. Volta's award-winning charging stations benefit brands, consumers, and real-estate locations by providing valuable advertising space to businesses and convenient charging to drivers. Strategically located in places consumers already visit, Volta's chargers are currently the most used electric vehicle charging stations in the United States.
The Opportunity at Volta Charging
Become a champion in helping to grow Volta's Data Infrastructure. This role will be tasked with managing and executing BI frameworks for transformation to a data-driven organization. Managing BI tools and products along with data ingestion to furnish insights, identify key metrics and transform raw data into meaningful, actionable information. If you are a detail-oriented BI manager who excels at multitasking and building relationships and is not uncomfortable in ambiguous or rapidly-evolving situations, you could thrive in this role!
In your first 90 days, you will
Learn about Votla’s Data Infrastructure
Take over management of offshore Data Infrastructure team and projects
Deliver Project Status reports and key metrics for affected teams and the Technology Steering Committee
Champion Volta’s Change Management process and ensures other technical team members are as well.
Begin building a roadmap of data transformation needs and system improvements projects.
After twelve months, you will have accomplished
Create a collaborative working relationship with key data contributors and consumers (Data Science team, Research and Analytics, Product and Engineering)
Continue to evolve the roadmap of data infrastructure and transformation needs and projects
Develop a user friendly data dictionary along with release notes to communicate and promote available data to business users
Act as an internal consultant to tease out opportunities and help teams rethink how they approach data, empowering them to take ownership and make data driven decisions.
Create a platform where the data is managed in a safe, secure, and sustainable way.
Create a process to promote and advocate for improved use of data across the organization.
Delivering training and coaching as needed to help with the adoption of data and BI.
Serve as the Scrum Master for our Data Lake JIRA ticketing system.
Meet regularly with business partners and team members to perform backlog grooming, identify new projects and deliver projects approved by the Technology Steering Committee
What you bring to Volta Charging:
5-8 years Managing and Architecting Data Lakes including security, compliance and support staff
Technical and functional knowledge of Data Infrastructure systems (Snowflake, Fivetran, Sigma)
Experience incorporating Data Privacy compliance regulations and requirements into business and technical processesGood understanding of SOX, GDPR and ITGC (IT General Controls)
Optimizes Work Processes- Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement. For example, motivates people to produce highest-quality outcomes and pursue continuous improvement. Sees that problems are well examined and improvements are integrated into all relevant work processes.
Drives Results - Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances. For example, emphasizes the importance of results; encourages a sense of urgency in others; challenges poor outcomes or unproductive behaviors. Provides assistance or encouragement to help others over obstacles.
Business Insight - Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals. For example, clearly understands how own activities relate to critical business drivers. Monitors business news and market changes for impact on the business or on their own expertise area; uses this to shape decisions.
Tech Savvy - Anticipates and adopts innovations in business-building digital and technology applications. For example, ensures that the team has adequate resources to invest in technology advancements and the training to use them well. Deploys some new technologies to enhance effectiveness of the group and business.
Customer Focus - Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer centric solutions. For example, digs deeply into customer feedback and drives the innovations that can enable the organization to better meet customers' future needs. Frequently adjusts approach to ensure customer needs are met and to improve service.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Description:
At EmployBridge, we are seeking a Manager of Data Analytics to support the design, development, integration and implementation of an analytic environment. Your talents, perspectives, and efforts will contribute directly to the production of valuable intelligence to facilitate positive change across the company. This position is for people who are looking for the exciting, fast-paced, and dynamically evolving data and analytics field, including data warehousing, reporting/dashboarding, machine learning and emerging technologies. The Manager of Data Analytics is responsible for the design, development, and implementation of data platforms, business intelligence and reporting systems and support of those systems. This position directs and manages IT plans, schedules, policies and programs for the organization's data and analytics systems, according to established company goals and objectives
Responsibilities:
Oversee the development of mission-critical applications and technology to support the company's long-term goals and provides direction and leadership to development teams.
Work directly with business leaders, leading cross-functional teams to analyze prioritized projects.
Partner with business and IT leaders on complex, large-scale business and technology transformations.
Lead management of strategic engagements with external consultants and key business stakeholders.
Contribute to the development of key insights and actionable strategies and tactics, based on market and competitive analysis.
Keeps current with trends and issues in the IT industry, including current technologies to advise, counsel, and educate executives and management on their competitive or financial impact.
Reviews current operating strategies and suggests process improvements to deliver the desired return on investment.
Identifies and evaluates technology enablers to deliver business value through accelerated growth or operational efficiency.
Work collaboratively with appropriate teams to manage security and data access governance
Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
Recommend improvements to data architectures to maximize business capabilities
Partner with Data Engineering to create dimensional models for data warehousing and provide data for dashboards and reporting
Very strong in SQL, writing complex queries for reporting and maintaining database objects
Experience in Python, R or other scripting languages
Leverage Data Mining techniques to find key business insights
Qualifications
Education and Experience:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or technical equivalent; Master’s preferred
Knowledge of industry-leading data management practices
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS
8+ years using modern BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, MicroStrategy)
Experience with ETL/ELT tools (Informatica, Talend)
10+ years of experience with modern, various databases & data store tools (Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, DB2, Redshift, RDS, DocumentDB, S3)
10+ years of experience with database administration and data warehousing
7-10 years of experience with statistical modeling and analyses
Experience with leveraging data governance frameworks and establishing methodologies
High degree of initiative and capacity to lead multiple priorities of significant scope in a fast-paced environment
Job Skills:
Expert level in SQL, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server
Familiar with UNIX/LINUX shell scripting
Strong skills with DAX and MDX in support of business solutions
Hands-on experience with leading analytic tools and methods
Experience in developing data pipelines and familiar with Cloud technologies
Experience and familiarity with statistical techniques and models
Strong experience with data modeling, data lineage, data warehousing and data marts
Proficient personal organization, productivity, and time management skills
Demonstrable confidence and enthusiasm about technology, innovation and problem solving
Strong team player and mindset
Desire to acquire and share new knowledge, skills, and abilities
EmployBridge is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

provide guidance on these specs to other healthcare data analystsProduce written reports and presentation materials re: project objectives, methods, data, and results-- Coordinate work of other team members, as needed-- Train and coach less experienced analysts, as needed, in Data retrieval techniques, Programming practices, Statistical analysis, Data visualization methods, Quality assurance reviews-- Data presentation, including: Determine most appropriate/informative way to summarize data and communicate analytical results; Develop innovative / custom templates for data presentationRequired QualificationsMinimum five years' relevant work experiencePost-graduate education (Masters' degree or doctoral degree)Training in advanced quantitative measurement methods (ex., mathematics or statistics)Ability to work in the US for any employer (H1B sponsorship not provided)General knowledge or work experience in one or more of the following areas: Data modeling, Machine learning, R, SQL, MS Azure (Cloud platforms), Python, Business Intelligence toolsSkilled in analytical methods including problem and model formulation, algorithm selection, and development of overall solution strategy.Desired Skills & QualificationsData presentationDemonstrated effective written and verbal communication of technical materialExperience working as a member of a technical project team on complex projectsExperience with analysis of large administrative databasesExperience with computer-intensive statistical analysis, multivariate statistical methods, and general research methodologyCreativity, critical thinking, and excellent problem-solving skillsOutstanding written and verbal communication and effective interpersonal skillsAbility to train and coach others on technical tasksKnowledge of healthcare industry, especially healthcare analytics'Fully Remote.Job Type: Full-timePay: From $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insuranceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Master's (Required)Work Location: One location

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Info:

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.
About Legrand North and Central America
Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.
About Legrand’s Data Center Power and Control Division
Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design. For more information, visit raritan.com and servertech.com

Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of

Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.

Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.

We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.
This job posting is not applicable in CO.

Salesforce Field Service Lightning implementation experience - THIS IS ESSENTIAL. DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE SALESFORCE FIELD SERVICE LIGHTNING - 2+ implementations

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

This position is for a Business Analyst to support the D365 implementation for Customer Service, Field Service and Project Services business functions. The role will be business facing to achieve the following:

Drive the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results

Create proposed solutions and ensure they meet internal standards

Assist with partnering with business leaders to build IT roadmaps that align to business strategies and goals
Summarize and communicate findings at an executive level

5 plus years related work experience
At least 3 years experience with design and configuration of MS Dynamics 365
Broad knowledge of computer systems and web based services
Hands-on experience gathering and writing requirements for business applications is required
Deep systems implementation, project management and technical IT or systems integration experience
Prior experience in business analysis for functional business services
Ability to organize information, manage tasks and projects to support business needs
Experience with in-house developed and delivered applications
Demonstrated ability to interface effectively with intermediate levels of management
Ability to flexibly accept dynamically changing priorities
Education/Training:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required
Industry Standard Technical Certifications desired: MS Dynamics and others showing depth of technical skill…
Information Architecture, Management Information Systems, Project Management Professional
Knowledge, skills & abilities:
Ability to organize, prioritize work, meet deadlines, and work independently
Ability to handle multiple projects and activities in a timely, organized manner
Requires technical and management skills appropriate to the position
Requires strong oral and written communication skills
Must be a creative problem solver, flexible, proactive, and work in a fast paced, ever changing environment
Ability to facilitate meetings and action plans
Must be a strong team playerIt is preferred this position sit in Lexington, KY, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Description:
At EmployBridge, we are seeking a Manager of Data Analytics to support the design, development, integration and implementation of an analytic environment. Your talents, perspectives, and efforts will contribute directly to the production of valuable intelligence to facilitate positive change across the company. This position is for people who are looking for the exciting, fast-paced, and dynamically evolving data and analytics field, including data warehousing, reporting/dashboarding, machine learning and emerging technologies. The Manager of Data Analytics is responsible for the design, development, and implementation of data platforms, business intelligence and reporting systems and support of those systems. This position directs and manages IT plans, schedules, policies and programs for the organization's data and analytics systems, according to established company goals and objectives
Responsibilities:
Oversee the development of mission-critical applications and technology to support the company's long-term goals and provides direction and leadership to development teams.
Work directly with business leaders, leading cross-functional teams to analyze prioritized projects.
Partner with business and IT leaders on complex, large-scale business and technology transformations.
Lead management of strategic engagements with external consultants and key business stakeholders.
Contribute to the development of key insights and actionable strategies and tactics, based on market and competitive analysis.
Keeps current with trends and issues in the IT industry, including current technologies to advise, counsel, and educate executives and management on their competitive or financial impact.
Reviews current operating strategies and suggests process improvements to deliver the desired return on investment.

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. positionName: Life and Annuity Senior Business Analyst
description:
Our Purpose
At Majesco, we believe in connecting people and business to Insurance in ways that are Innovative, Hyper-Relevant, Compelling and Personal. We bring together the brightest minds to build the future of Insurance; a world where Insurance makes life and business easier, more connected and better protected.
Job Overview
The Lead Business Analyst - Technical will carry the ownership of identifying business objectives, work with customers to define business process changes by producing requirement and functional design documents & supporting execution of integration tests, including monitoring software incidents and communicating software issues & tracked to the closure.
Key Role and Responsibilities
Extensive and demonstrable experience (at least 8 years + in the North American L&A industry) in relation to:
Excellent business and domain knowledge of the North American Life & Annuity Insurance industry, especially in Policy Admin Implementations
Working with customers to define configuration requirements, and developing an overall configuration approach for the client
Producing requirement and functional design documents using an agile gap-analysis and directed requirements approach to lead the customer needs definition
Estimating the effort required to configure the system
Configuring the products and business process rules to solve customer business challenges
Working with Product management to share customer configuration concepts and further develop our base product features
Identifying opportunities to meet customer business objectives using business logic and configuring applications to meet those objectives
Project management experience
Experience gathering requirements/user stories, understanding North American Life & Annuity product specifications and designing business process flows
Experience implementing North American Life & Annuity products on Policy Administration systems
Knowledge of Group and Individual North American L&A markets
Agile or SAFe experience is a plus
All About You
Minimum 8+ years of experience in Life, Health, Annuity or supporting these products with at least 5-10 years of experience working in software companies building software in the above areas.
 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Applications or global equivalent required.
 LOMA Certifications is a plus.
Majesco is a leading insurance solutions and services provider.
Majesco's software for core insurance functions include Policy Administration, Underwriting, New Business Processing, Billing, Claims, Product Modeling, Incentive Compensation and Producer Life cycle Management. Additionally, Majesco offers consulting and insurance specific IT services for testing, data conversion, data-warehousing/BI, mobility, enterprise integration and BPM. Majesco specializes in connecting people and business to insurance in ways that are innovative, hyper-relevant, compelling and personal. Our technology, expertise and leadership helps insurers modernize, innovate and connect to build the future of their business – and the industry – at speed and at scale.
Majesco is an inclusive equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local laws regarding equal employment opportunity. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religious beliefs, sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by federal, state and/or local employment laws.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting and your contact information. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. This email alias is not for the general submission of application materials and any application materials submitted through this alias will not be considered. In addition, Majesco will not provide a response to inquiries made to reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com that are not related to accessibility of the online application system by persons with disabilities.

Sprout Mortgage's technology team is growing, and we are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, you'll work to develop custom built solutions for retail loan officer, wholesale, correspondent, and loan manufacturing systems inside a developing digital ecosystem for the mortgage industry. You must understand the needs of different user personas and be able to articulate these to various groups within the product team and business organization. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and help implement the deployment plan. You will be asked to wear many hats and be a front-line contributor in leading product development. You will be the voice of the business to the development team and answer any questions and provide clarification on requirements. If you do not know the answer, you will find out from the relevant party. We are looking for a Do-It-All Rockstar who is great at building relationships, someone who will go the extra mile, wants to help build market defining products, and grow to manage their own product(s) in the future.

Desired Skills & Experience

Required

3+ years of experience working as a business analyst, preferably with finance/mortgage knowledge.
Experience working with new product development, creation of various artifacts such as SRS, FS, Use Cases, Data Flows and Process Flows for specific features within a project release.
Ability to meet with various business/client partners to understand their needs and challenge.
Must be able to write clear and concise business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Capable of analyzing and documenting data transformations and logic that need to be built to support the exchange of information, both internal and external.
Competency in basic product smoke testing.
Experience working within standard Agile methodologies, including, but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban.
Lead process improvement with your business partners and identify bottlenecks.
Experience working with a distributed team.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or foreign equivalent required.

Preferred

Experience with EllieMae Encompass
Strong core Business Analysis skills in the areas of elicitation, requirements analysis, business process improvement, requirements modeling, gap analysis, functional decomposition and design, data modeling, rapid prototyping, and other techniques (Agile experience preferable).
Strong analytical skills with an understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Experience with JIRA or any other project management tool (bonus if you know Aha!).
Experience with Cloud Environments (i.e., AWS, Azure, and Google).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Learns quickly when facing new problems, enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and is willing to experiment and try anything to find solutions.
Ability to effectively manage and facilitate meetings.
Self-motivated, strong initiative, flexible and good time management skills
Good knowledge on Mortgage Rules & Regulations as well as mortgage related data.
Help with UAT Testing and Analysis of test results.

Perform market research/business intelligence to ensure forecasts are accurate
Identify and create process improvements for reporting and dashboards
Partner with internal business leaders to uncover opportunities and provide insights based on financial results
Present forecasts, variance analysis and commentary to key stakeholders
Other duties as required

One to three years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) within a financial services environment; preferred candidates will have mortgage experience

Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis

We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
