Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Senior Data Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Senior Data Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Senior Data Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Use your raw data analysis intuition to identify trends and patterns in our Machine Learning models
Be a data detective, and understand all of Clear Capital’s internal data sets, as well as those of potential external partners. Apply that knowledge to our machine learning initiatives
Develop data transformations and pipelines to deliver quality data at scale
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience in a technical field and 8+ years of overall experience
Strong python scripting development experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Experience with data pipelines and ETL techniques a plus
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!
Inclusive benefits package offerings 401k plans and customizable benefits including dental, vision, medical, etc. for you and your dependents.
An innovative culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.
Company supported and employee-driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working on a hybrid schedule and philanthropy.
Learning and development programs to help advance your career and personal growth.
What we value
Wherever it leads, Whatever it takes! We believe in making the impossible possible!
Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!
Innovate, learn, lead- Knowledge and growth is never ending!
We believe in hiring nice people because anything is possible when you have the team's support.
Improving the lives around us- A smile could change the entire world.
Be the most trusted, respected, and loved real estate valuation company in the world.
About Us
Clear Capital is the premier provider of real estate valuation, analytics, and technology solutions. Powered by its more than 45 years worth of information on nearly every U.S. metro, neighborhood, and property, Clear Capital’s solutions are trusted by community credit unions and billion-dollar financial institutions alike. Clear Capital is headquartered in Reno-Tahoe with a team of more than 700 nationwide, dedicated to going wherever it leads, and doing whatever it takes.

#INDP
#LI-REMOTE

Senior Data Analyst

CA or TX-Remote


This is a CA-remote or TX-Remote, Exempt, Full-Time position. This position reports to the Chief Technology Officer of the Company.

Why Movoto?

Movoto Real Estate is the fastest-growing top 5 residential real estate site used by 650,000 buyers and sellers daily. As we scale for rapid growth, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to guide the development of key components of our portal.


What we're looking for in you:

As a Senior Data Analyst at Movoto, you will be a key player in helping us impact thousands of consumer home shoppers and real estate agents. You will be responsible for statistics and data collection for all traffic and online behaviors. You will own the definition of all data tracking, integration, and verification. In this role, you will work closely with product managers and analysts to define, and review tracking policy, and work closely with engineers to implement and verify data. This role will require a Product Manager mindset along with the technical skills of web-related data.
What you'll be doing:

Define problems and opportunities of current user behavior combined with traffic and product goals.
Define how to track and monitor data working closely with traffic and product managers and maintain all tracking definitions with documentation.
Create tagging/tracking strategy and work with engineering to ensure the right data is being measured.
Manage, maintain, and refine the global implementation of Google Analytics and 3rd party campaign tagging.


What you should have:

B.A./B.S./Master's in economics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative focus.
3+ years of experience in data analyst or data science
Experience in managing tracking for entire traffic and online user behaviors required
Experience setting tagging strategy and implementing tags with Google Tag Manager
Ability to verify the tracking implementation
Strong communication and organization skills
Working experience with large datasets using data analytics tools
Experience in creating entire tracking from scratch
Excellent SQL skills and experience with BI dashboards
Proficient in tools such as A/B testing platforms (VWO, Optimizely), analytics solutions (Oracle, Tealeaf, Clicktale aka Contentsquare, Indicative, Kissmetrics, Tableau), and other various qualitative survey tools
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Google Analytics
SEO/SEM experience


Why you should join Movoto?

Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits
100%/75% premium coverage for employees/dependents
Basic & Supplemental Life Insurance, AD&D and Disability, FSA and Commuter Benefits
Retirement Plan
Equity
Flexible Paid Time Off
Paid Holidays
Parental Leave Benefits
Competitive Salaries
Volunteer Opportunities
Employee Engagement Events
PetPlan (10-15% off premiums)
PerkSpot – exclusive corporate discounts
Rocket Lawyer Legal Benefits and more!


About Movoto Real Estate

Movoto Real Estate was founded on a simple principle: Real estate should be easy.

This foundational idea continues to drive our mission every day, building cutting-edge, optimized technology tools and connecting talented, customer-focused agents with motivated buyers and sellers. Today, we are the fastest-growing top five residential real estate site in the United States with nearly 26 million monthly visits. But we are more than a real estate brokerage and research site—we're a technology company that is bringing real estate into the future with our end-to-end suite of proprietary tools for buyers, sellers, and agents.

In 2020, Movoto was acquired by OJO Labs, a leader in personalized, AI-enabled real estate tools. Combining OJO and Movoto's deep commitment to creating end-to-end home-buying solutions, we continue to strive to become the most trusted real estate company in North America. Our real estate technology platform comprises the latest data-driven AI technology, client communication tools, marketing and transaction support, a real team of dedicated transaction coordinators, and an agent earnings structure that ensures our agents are successful and can focus on serving their clients.

Movoto is not only committed to making real estate accessible to a diverse community through technology, we strive to increase representation—across all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, sexual orientations, and physical or mental abilities—in our teams. We continue to promote an inclusive work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.

Together with OJO and our growing team, we have renewed our dedication to the mission that started it all: making real estate easy in this rapidly changing world.

This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.

Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications

Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.

Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.

Overview:

Data Analyst III - REMOTE
Company Overview:
CoventBridge Group is the leading worldwide full-service investigation solutions company providing: Surveillance, SIU and Compliance, Claims Investigation, Counter-Fraud Programs, Desktop Investigations, Social Media, Record Retrieval, Canvasses and Vendor Management programs. With offices in the UK and U.S. the company provides top tier data privacy and security practices, deploys robust case management technology customized to clients’ needs and delivers worldwide coverage via its 1000 employees and affiliates worldwide.
About the Opportunity:
The Data Analyst III Performs high-level complex evaluation and analysis of data to support potential fraud cases and requests for information using claims data across multiple Medicare/Medicaid benefit types. The potential fraud cases involve high dollar amounts, sensitive issues, or otherwise meet criteria for referral to law enforcement, recoupment of overpayment, and/or administrative action based on reactive and proactive data analysis. Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analyst associates and assists management with special projects.
In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting CoventBridge Group's objective: To provide services to our clients that exceed their expectations and contribute to improved healthcare delivery by identifying and eliminating fraud, waste and abuse.

The Data Analyst III position will report to the Data Supervisor and will work in our Grove City, OH office or if not local, remotely from a home office.
Responsibilities/ Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Work with local management, investigators, and analysts to provide reactive and proactive case development support and to fulfill law enforcement data requests.
Communicate effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.
Performs quality assurance and validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare or Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.
Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analysts.
Develops and documents new processes and procedures to improve staff efficiency and better meet department and contract goals.
Works with Statisticians and Data Analysts to ensure quality data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.
Prepares, develops, and participates in staff training as related to Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.
Proactively monitors data sources (claims data, internet, etc.) to identify new and emerging Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste, and abuse trends.
Comply with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.
Assists with special projects that require complex analysis of data.
Requirements:
A minimum of three (3) years of previous experience in healthcare data analytics, with preference given to candidates with Medicare/Medicaid program integrity experience
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data; specifically, Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM codes, physician specialty codes) is required.
Have high proficiency level with MS Office Products.
Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other software applications necessary to perform healthcare claims data analytics.
Full COVID-19 vaccination and documentation are required as this position directly or indirectly supports a Federal Government Contract. [2 doses of Moderna or Pfizer; 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson]. Medical and religious accommodations are considered for exemption.
Benefits:

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision plans
Life, LTD and STD paid by the employer
401(k) with company match up to 4%
Paid Time Off and company paid holidays
Tuition assistance after 1 year of service
*CoventBridge is proud to be an EEO-AA employer M/F/D/V.*
UPIC

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Job Description


Summary/objective

The Sales Analyst will collect and analyze large sets of data from a diverse range of sources and platforms. The Sales Analyst will also be tasked with developing and presenting their insightful data findings to Senior leadership, which will ultimately influence strategic decisions and help guide the overall sales strategy.


Essential functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Compile and analyze data to forecast sales trends, some immediate and some over time
Communicate with management team regularly regarding trends and plans
Review past sales data to determine trends in productivity and create the plan for future growth opportunities
Prepare accurate reports using data from internal and external sources
Evaluate third-party data to determine best practices for the company’s success
Present actionable information and insights to team members and management
Gather and analyze data to understand problems and address them proactively
Collaborate with team members and members of other departments and create solutions that will aid in achieving sales results
Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover all possible activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or finance, or work experience in a related field
3 years’ experience in a position involving strategy and analytics
Strong knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, database, and presentation software
Advanced knowledge with MS Office products
Advanced problem-solving and analysis skills
Has a familiarity and comfort level in working with large data sets
Superior oral and written communication skills
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative
Good attitude toward teamwork to work interdependently, as well as the ability to work independently
Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize efficiently
Excellent time management skills


Preferred Qualifications:

Have worked in the automotive space, understanding its trends and sales opportunities
Have worked with Salesforce as a CRM


Supervisory responsibilities

This role has no supervisory responsibilities


Work environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers.


Physical demands

Physical requirements also include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Required to have visual acuity to operate motor vehicles.


Travel required

Travel will be required up to 30% of the time


Work authorization/security clearance requirements

N/A

Our Purpose
At Majesco, we believe in connecting people and business to Insurance in ways that are Innovative, Hyper-Relevant, Compelling and Personal. We bring together the brightest minds to build the future of Insurance; a world where Insurance makes life and business easier, more connected and better protected.
All About the Role:
Majesco is seeking an experienced, client-facing Business Analyst to serve as a cornerstone to our clients by blending insurance domain knowledge with a thorough understanding of Majesco software solutions. The Business Analyst will be a key liaison between the Insurance carrier and the Majesco software development teams.
Assist clients in effectively gathering business requirements
Understand and analyze client’s documentation, identifying implications, issues, and risks
Maintain a Traceability Matrix for mapping the customer requirements to corresponding functions
Develop business rating requirements documentation from client specifications
Prioritize customer’s requirements throughout the release lifecycle
Analyze and evaluate existing and/or proposed insurance systems
Analyze underwriting and rating manuals to determine rating similarities and differences across states
Work with multiple stakeholders to support development of client’s core insurance software solution and business process
Create visual design diagrams for all audiences
Develop test plans & participate in the testing process to ensure high quality project deliverables
Review test cases created by the client
Interact with other team members and clients to ensure quality solution
Effortlessly communicate with the client to track and debug testing issues, resolve them, and perform regression testing.
Act a mentor to colleagues and the client; train customers on solutions provided
Support development of detailed requirements, user stories and functional design documents that can be referenced by global delivery staff, respond to their questions, and reconcile the functionality of their deliverables to these documents.
Perform gap analysis for new requirements in case of product implementation. Manage scope of work and support to project team in query resolution
Act as a product owner and represent the customer and the business in a scrum team
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of experience in strategic BA role for large scale projects in IT
Strong Property & Casualty domain experience and expertise on Policy administration systems
Knowledge of ISO/NCCI rating (manuals)
5+ years of experience in requirements gathering and management of Commercial Lines web-based applications (e.g. Worker’s Compensation and Commercial Auto & other LOB’s) or Personal Lines web-based applications (e.g. Personal Auto, Homeowners Insurance & other LOB’s)
Experienced in processes in SAFe methodology (Scaled Agile Framework)
Work Experience
Overall 10+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with at least 5+ years of experience in Property & Casualty commercial lines.
Business Travel and Physical Demands
This is a remote position, based in the US. Business travel of approximately 30% yearly is expected for this position once the threat of COVID subsides.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree or global equivalent required

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
If you would like to contact SWCA regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the online application process due to a disability, please email accommodations@swca.com or call 1-480-581-5378. This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Sprout Mortgage's technology team is growing, and we are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, you'll work to develop custom built solutions for retail loan officer, wholesale, correspondent, and loan manufacturing systems inside a developing digital ecosystem for the mortgage industry. You must understand the needs of different user personas and be able to articulate these to various groups within the product team and business organization. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and help implement the deployment plan. You will be asked to wear many hats and be a front-line contributor in leading product development. You will be the voice of the business to the development team and answer any questions and provide clarification on requirements. If you do not know the answer, you will find out from the relevant party. We are looking for a Do-It-All Rockstar who is great at building relationships, someone who will go the extra mile, wants to help build market defining products, and grow to manage their own product(s) in the future.

Desired Skills & Experience

Required

3+ years of experience working as a business analyst, preferably with finance/mortgage knowledge.
Experience working with new product development, creation of various artifacts such as SRS, FS, Use Cases, Data Flows and Process Flows for specific features within a project release.
Ability to meet with various business/client partners to understand their needs and challenge.
Must be able to write clear and concise business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Capable of analyzing and documenting data transformations and logic that need to be built to support the exchange of information, both internal and external.
Competency in basic product smoke testing.
Experience working within standard Agile methodologies, including, but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban.
Lead process improvement with your business partners and identify bottlenecks.
Experience working with a distributed team.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or foreign equivalent required.

Preferred

Experience with EllieMae Encompass
Strong core Business Analysis skills in the areas of elicitation, requirements analysis, business process improvement, requirements modeling, gap analysis, functional decomposition and design, data modeling, rapid prototyping, and other techniques (Agile experience preferable).
Strong analytical skills with an understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Experience with JIRA or any other project management tool (bonus if you know Aha!).
Experience with Cloud Environments (i.e., AWS, Azure, and Google).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Learns quickly when facing new problems, enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and is willing to experiment and try anything to find solutions.
Ability to effectively manage and facilitate meetings.
Self-motivated, strong initiative, flexible and good time management skills
Good knowledge on Mortgage Rules & Regulations as well as mortgage related data.
Help with UAT Testing and Analysis of test results.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Senior Data Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Senior Data Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Senior Data Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Use your raw data analysis intuition to identify trends and patterns in our Machine Learning models
Be a data detective, and understand all of Clear Capital’s internal data sets, as well as those of potential external partners. Apply that knowledge to our machine learning initiatives
Develop data transformations and pipelines to deliver quality data at scale
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience in a technical field and 8+ years of overall experience
Strong python scripting development experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Experience with data pipelines and ETL techniques a plus
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!
Inclusive benefits package offerings 401k plans and customizable benefits including dental, vision, medical, etc. for you and your dependents.
An innovative culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.
Company supported and employee-driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working on a hybrid schedule and philanthropy.
Learning and development programs to help advance your career and personal growth.
What we value
Wherever it leads, Whatever it takes! We believe in making the impossible possible!
Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!
Innovate, learn, lead- Knowledge and growth is never ending!
We believe in hiring nice people because anything is possible when you have the team's support.
Improving the lives around us- A smile could change the entire world.
Be the most trusted, respected, and loved real estate valuation company in the world.
About Us
Clear Capital is the premier provider of real estate valuation, analytics, and technology solutions. Powered by its more than 45 years worth of information on nearly every U.S. metro, neighborhood, and property, Clear Capital’s solutions are trusted by community credit unions and billion-dollar financial institutions alike. Clear Capital is headquartered in Reno-Tahoe with a team of more than 700 nationwide, dedicated to going wherever it leads, and doing whatever it takes.
Clear Capital is an equal opportunity employer.
To all recruitment agencies: Clear Capital does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Clear Capital employees, or any other company location. Clear Capital is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Kwx is an integrated home experience company that seamlessly unites the KW ecosystem to keep the agent at the center of the homeownership journey.
Austin, Texas-based kwx is the holding company of Keller Williams Realty, the world’s largest real estate technology franchise by agent count. With more than 1,070 offices and 190,000 associates worldwide, Keller Williams is also No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States.
In 2020, Keller Williams initially began the formation of kwx, composed of Keller Williams, Keller Williams Worldwide, Keller Offers and Keller Home Financial Services, consisting of Keller Mortgage and Keller Covered.
Since 1983, the company has cultivated an agent-centric, technology-driven and education-based culture that rewards agents as stakeholders. For more information, visit kwx.kw.com.
We consider the health and safety of our team members to be of paramount importance. Therefore, the Company’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy applies to all team members who physically work in the Austin, TX or Dublin, OH offices. It does not apply to team members who are working remotely (unless they come into the Company’s offices, in which case, this policy applies).
Essential Job Functions and Basic Duties
Create & implement performance analytic reporting & analysis for supported business units
In conjunction with the business leaders develop a forecasting model & process that can be used for both short term/long term projections
Work with sales & operations teams to develop capacity planning models
Perform market research/business intelligence to ensure forecasts are accurate as well as identifying industry benchmarks
Identify and create process improvements for reporting and dashboards
Partner with internal business leaders to uncover opportunities and provide insights based on financial results vs targets
Present forecasts, variance analysis and commentary to key stakeholders
Assist in the development of a framework to analyze data that will result in automated reporting
Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills are required
Five or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) within a financial services environment; preferred candidates will have mortgage experience
Experience in building complex financial models, capacity planning and forecasting tools
Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis
Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
Proven proficiency with data query/data management tools (SQL, Tableau et al)
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field
MBA or CFA preferred
Kwx is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Kwx recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics disability, age, veteran status, or other protected status as required by applicable law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

Business Analyst – The Greeley Company
About The Greeley Company
The Greeley Company is a leading provider of consulting, education, interim staffing, credentialing management, and external peer review to healthcare organizations nationwide. Headquartered in the greater Boston area, The Greeley Company has helped more than 1,000 healthcare organizations within the past three years address challenges related to regulatory compliance, credentialing and privileging, peer review, clinician burnout, bylaws and physician-hospital alignment.
The Greeley Company joined The Chartis Group in 2019. The Chartis Group is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, operations and performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, Chartis helps leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals, physician enterprises and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
Across both Greeley and Chartis, we are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission “to improve healthcare delivery”, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities.
Role Overview
The Greeley Business Analyst should be energetic, a team player, and an enthusiastic learner. Flexibility with respect to travel and on-site engagements is essential. The Business Analyst will support consulting services by performing analytical and support functions with respect to client deliverables and program management.
Responsibilities
Client Deliverables
Data Collection and Analysis: Creates and maintains analytical tools to be used by consultants and clients.
Assessment Tools: Creates and maintains assessment tools in SurveyMonkey, Excel, and similar on-line tools that enable quick reporting and scoring of vulnerabilities and recommendations arising from assessments performed by consultants. Cross reference assessment reports to create and maintain a repository of findings with corresponding recommendations.
Referral Base: In collaboration with business unit leaders and business development, create and maintain a client referral base for services in each practice.
Relational Databases: Designs, creates, and maintains relational databases that
Project Management: Creates, modifies, and maintains project management tools for short- and long-term engagements.
Creation of, maintenance of, and support for template assessment reports, project management work sheets, including the creation of user-friendly Gantt charts, client power points
Creation and maintenance of project reports and workplans for complex engagements such as System CVO Build, Business Process Outsourcing Redesign and Implementation, System Wide Privileging.
Support of CME accreditation for BPO sites
Meeting Support: Creates, modifies, and supports real-time meeting management tools, including
Attendance at meetings (onsite or remote) and incorporates decisions made by the client (by facilitation of the consultant) into the template Master documents for review by the Consultant
Client/Consultant Training and Support
Provides visual sophistication to client deliverables, documentation of workflows and identifies areas for a potential higher level of analysis
Documents Management
Capturing and maintaining on-line repositories for engagement-related documents.
Practice Management

positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience
POSTING DETAILS
Posting Number: 51232
Hours of Work: Mon. - Fri., 8:30 AM - 5 PM
Job Code: 960
Location: Open to various locations
Reports to: Manager, Corp. HR
Working Conditions: Office Environment

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
If you would like to contact SWCA regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the online application process due to a disability, please email accommodations@swca.com or call 1-480-581-5378. This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.
